text: Draft at Tap10. Hazy dark orange with a beige head. Aroma of yeast, malt, oak, smoky. Flavour has sweet smoky notes. Oak, malt, light yeast, slight salt. Aftertaste is moderate sweet with a wooden touch.

Murky amber, brown-ish, small light beige bit of foam. Low retention. Sweet and smokey nose, with a mellow seabuckthorn-like acidity, some fragrant wood (hints of white oak?), smoked meats, berries, caramel. The front is nice, with some juicy, mildly tart berries, some sweet malt, smoked dried wood and grain. Some caramel crust, dried grass, mild hay, with a nice juniper fragrance developing, nice and sharp, reminding me of gin. Some bitterness, woody in nature, with a lot more smoke in the finish, but not the bacony one usually found in rauchbiers. A stronger, burnt, ashy kind, dry and rugged. Some bit of caramel and that gin note lingers, too. Medium body and carbonation. A tiny bit of warm alcohol. A solid traditional beer, really interesting, not holding anything back, at the risk of being a bit too rough. But i enjoyed it a lot.
From bottle. Pours cloudy dark amber. Nose of berries, resin, smoke. Taste is light smoke, loads of fruit, light malts.
Flaske 0,5L smakt januar 2013. Aroma malt, brent tre, røyk. Utseende uklar mørk gylden med offwhite skum. Smak malt, røyk, mørk frukt, krydder. En røykpreget ale

Bottle. I guess Im going off the smoked ales but I prefer this to the heavy malty black smoked beers out there. I am a little dissapainted however, Im not getting that much juniper or wood, just smoke (but in a good Belgian fashion).

Une mousse timide mais toutefois persistante au-dessus dune bière cuivrée. Des arômes de plus intéressants alliant la fumée et le genévrier, lui donnant un air dexpédition en forêt, de camping sauvage et de prélèvement sur le bord dune rivière isolée. Poisson et/ou jambon fumé(s). Les saveurs sont de la même famille où laspect fumé prend moins de place. Cest presque antiseptique. On prend une marche dans une tourbière. Plus quagréable pour moi. *Batch 997 MA 22.06.2018) (2139-230317)

Bottle; pours cloudy brown with a tan head; smoky aroma with hints of wood, caramel, and juniper; taste is smoky with some caramel, juniper, wood, and burnt sugar notes; smoky finish is dry and slightly bitter

Aromat: przyjemny, czuć jak suszone i wędzone owoce, nuty wędzone bardzo przyjemne i łagodne
Wygląd: bardzo ładne, czerwono miedziane, przejrzyste, biała drobnopęcherzykowa pianka na niecały centymetr, szybko redukuje się do otoczki na powierzchni. Trochę osadu na dnie butelki
Smak: wpierw likierowa słodycz ale tylko przez pierwsze sekundy. Później czujemy pełną ciała, ale nie nazbyt ciężką, leciutko podwędzaną podstawę słodową wypełnioną smakiem jałowca. Super że jałowiec wyraźnie tu czuć, bo często to dodatek jakiegoś składnika znajduje się tylko w postaci napisu na etykiecie. Ten jałowiec, jak ktoś nie zna można by ewentualnie porównać do czerwonej borówki lub jarzębiny. Jest też troszkę karmelu z podbudowy słodowej, są rodzynki. Wędzoność jak dla mnie idealna, bo delikatna i zbalansowana, podbija tylko bogaty i ciekawy smak. Dla mnie rewelacja. Nie odstraszy ona nikogo od piwa, nawet wrogów wędzonych aromatów i smaków. Na finiszu mamy przyjemną, średnią goryczkę przywodzącą na myśl igły sosny i cierpkie, mięsiste, gorzkawe owoce- znów jałowiec. Wysycenie niskie, pijalność średnia na skutek mnogości i bogactwa smaków i aromatów. Bardzo dobre, świetnie wykonane, bogate i mega ciekawe piwo
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Hazy orange with grayish head. Vomit, brown malt, tropical fruit. Dark malt, fruit spice. Sweet with a sticky palate.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottle. Amber Brown. Strong smokey taste from smoked & roasted malts. Berries (apparently juniper) & dark fruits. Caramel. Woody, earthy & rather salty. Bitter edge (the juniper?) throughout . Smoky, roasty dry finish. Unique Beer! (2008)
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Reddish brown colour. Murky. Aroma is firewood and caramel. Taste is lightly smoked with some malt.

Bottle pour at Shelton Brothers. Wood-smoked ham and toasted chestnuts on the nose. Clean and crisp on the palate with some juniper berry notes. Smoke is not overdone and sits nicely in the background.
Draft at Pizzeria Paradiso Georgetown. Poured a mostly clear red color, small tan head. Aroma was fresh forrest campfire. Not too smokey, some light fresh cut wood? Light sweet malts. Interesting.
Smoke and some caramel. Reddish pour with ok head. Some boiled down malt. Copper pour. Tap at Pizza Paradiso.

From bottle. Color is dark copper, with moderate foam of beige color. Aroma signaling the smoked character in an interesting non-invasive way, but also malt, in the form of caramel. Body is medium-thick. Taste consistent with aroma, again smoked and caramel, maybe licorice. Some sweetness and some bitterness, beer well balanced. Palate is nice too.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
dark brown color; slightly smoky aroma; smooth, malty, slightly smoky flavor; just the right amount of smoky flavor

Rousse voilé. Grosse mousse beige. Très fumé. forte effervescence. Fumé de bois. Sirop de bouleau. Léger malt caramel. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Sèche. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #2210 - 2015.12.02 - @7Degrees Beer School. Pours a dark reddish brown color. thin head. Unreal aroma of ripened juniper berry, wood smoke, earth,chocolate, caramel. Lots of smoked malt character present, tempered with a spiciness (coriander, clove, nutmeg?). Phenomenal old world brew.

est to wędzone ale z dodatkiem owoców jałowca. Ponoć tradycyjnie warzone na terenie Norwegii. Piwo ma barwę mocnej herbaty i jest mętne, a na górze utworzyła się bardzo ładna czapa piany. Zapach jest raczej płaski i dominuje w nim wędzona szynka oraz wyraźny i mi nie pasujący jałowiec. W smaku jest już znacznie lepiej i ciekawiej. Piwo jest pełne i gęste. Wędzonka gra pierwsze skrzypce balansując między szynką a dymem ogniska. Żaden jałowiec jałowo nie zakłóca mi odbioru. Jest tak smaczne i pijalne, jak tylko może być.

Bottle from the back of my fridge. Pours murky brown and has a real smoked wood aroma with a sort of brine quality as well. molasses and figs, peat and a some more exotic fruit. Good length, smoky flavour some light bitterness on the finish and molasses flavour. Very tasty.
Robe cuivrée fumée. Peu de mousse. En bouche, très "herbeux" (peaty; tourbe). Alcool peu présent, donc bien balancé, mais goûte très peu la fumée. Pas du tout comme une rauchbier.

Beer dark brown, somewhat hazy. creamy beige foam and bubbly. complex scent with notes of burnt wood, smoked malt, wine, resin and moss. Presence of juniper but little dominant. solid flavor with notes of charred wood, smoke, bread, candy, sweet cereals, burnt sugar and heather. medium bitterness, slightly sweet and good and on par complex balance between malt, hops and smoke.

wedzonka, czyc dymy, drewno oraz stopiony karmel. Slodowe jest to piwo bardziej niz chmielne. Smak wyczuwalny takze jalowiec i pieprz czarny. Wyglad to herbaciano czerwona barwa srednio metne. Ze srednia i malo trwala piana. Dobre ale liczylem na ciut wiecej.

0.5l bottle.

Dark orange or nearly brown and cloudy. Tan head with some lacing. Roasted taste with what seems like spices.
Dark orange color. Aromas of smoke, charcoal and wood. Smoked taste with some sour hints of fir needle. Finish is long and bitter. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 From XXXII. In Bavaria glass. Watching Game of Thrones 6x04. Another smoky beer, not of the worst ones but the smokiness still hides all and dont feel the juniper berries nor anything else much

Bottle. Pours a coppery body with a frothy offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, smoke, malts, wood and some light roast. Flavor is light sweet and malt-driven. Some smoke, cured meats and malts. Fairly balanced and drinks quite well. Probably very nice with some bbq but does quite well on its own too. Light bitter finish. Medium body, avg+ co2

Piana bardzo szybko redukuje sie jedynie do pierscienia wokol szkla. Piwo przezroczyste w kolorze herbaty. W aromacie wedzonosc i drewno. Czuc tez jakby palony karmel. W smaku czuc dym i slody. Lekko wytrawne ze srednim wysyceniem. Goryczka bardzo slaba, raczej taka jakby palona. Czuc tez suszone owoce. Ciekawa kombinacja.

Di color ramato molto opalescente con schiuma color beige chiaro a grana grossa, non abbondante e nemmeno persistente. Al naso note affumicate leggere,ginepro e lieve legno. Corpo snello e carbonazione bassa. Al palato ancora ginepro,biscotto e lieve affumicato. Amaro leggero finale. Buona la secchezza ela scorrevolezza.
Bottle. Brownred with short lasting white head. Aroma is wood, dried dark fruits and some smoked. Taste is juniperberries, smoked. and some wood, or burnt wood.
Bruin bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is gerookt en kruidig, licht zoet, drop en zoethout. Erg goed.

Haandbryggeriet Norwegian Wood 6.5%

Had this ages ago at the old Tadgs and was blown away. Lost that rating but am enjoying a bottle of it now. It pours a soft attractive mahogany with a thick light beige head of foam.

The aroma is attractively smokey, honey glazed ham and a berry sweetness. 

Its medium-full bodied with a sandpapery carbonation. The taste is a balanced smoke & sweetness, honey, berry sweetness, some, ham and just a terrific smoked ale. 

It amazes me you can get a 500ml bottle of this in Japan for a bit over 1000¥, buy this when you see it & you wont be disappointed.

Sensoric. Bottle. Deep brown/reddish witm medium, semi-densed color. Poor lacing and head retention. Nice medium smoked wood aroma along with some black fruits accents. Taste is semi-dry with some nice smokey malty finish. Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation. In general interesting and complementary dark fruits and smokey combination.
Hazy pale brown colour. Aroma has light smoke and leather. Flavour also has a smokiness together with a light fruitiness.
Dark amber with big long lasting tan orange head. Aroma smoke, hot granite, mineral, wheat seseme, campfire. Tastes big smoke, slight caramel honey ham, toasted wood. slight citrus of juniper

Aroma: Medium-low intensiveness, very caramelly, some smoke, floral notes, a lot of metal which dominates the aroma afer time. Appearance: Color is dark amber, head is high, not very durable. Taste: Bonfire smokiness, wood, light floral and estery accents, symbolic juniper aftertaste, bitterness medium, lightly lingering but pleasantly, with time gets more sweet, caramel. Palate: Finish is sweet, carbonation is quite high - too high, body is medium.

Appearance: clear medium-deep amber with two fingers of fine light tan head, good retention and patchy lacing. (4/5) Aroma: smoke, caramel malt, floral, light sharp juniper. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate smoke, mild bitter, mild spice. (7/10) Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, lingering smokey finish. (3/5)

Smoke definitely leads the way here, but it doesnt overwhelm the sweet caramel and floral aromas - think smokey bacon and youre not far off. There is a subtle juniper presence coming through as a bright sharpness in the aroma and a mild spiciness on the tongue, but I think Id prefer a little more emphasis there. The body is surprisingly light, driven by a lively sustained carbonation, which I think prevents the smoke from building and lingering more than it does. Quite pleasant and approachable for a smoked beer, and reminiscent of Aecht Schlenkerla rauchbier, but definitely not everybodys cup of tea. (14/20)

12 oz. pour at Holy Grale. Aroma: Moderate woody smoke; light caramel glazed bread; very light juniper. Appearance: Hazy dark cola brown pour with a sticky tan head that settles into a skin. Flavor: Smoke leads with bready malts in the backseat; juniper is very much an afterthought flavor-wise, and theres just a touch of it towards the finish, which is mostly dry. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, flat carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: I would have liked a little more balance between smoke and other flavors in play.

Cloudy dark amber, offwhite fluffy head. Floral hops, malty, caramely aroma with notes of juniper and very light hints of smoke. Flavour has smoke, more malt, a little spice and hoppy bitterness. Nice and well balanced.
Bottle. Dark amber with white foam. Aroma: caramel, light smoke, halva, coffee and chocolate. Taste: caramel, toffee, wood, a little candies.
Taste: robust, smoked woody malt, unique notes of earthy spices and dry finish. Dark amber color with a smoked bacon nose, Medium to full body. Large head. Made Juniper berries.

Dark brown colour with a creamy head. Aroma of malt, caramel, juniper berry and some smoke. 
Taste of juniper berry, caramel, malt and pine needle. Creamy flavour with sweetness and caramel in front and a dry aftertaste. Nice texture. Spicy.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
On tap. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 08/10/2015 Color ambar, aroma ahumado, malta, sabor caramelo ahumado sutil.cuerpo medio

Kindly shared by Jaghana. Couleur brune trouble, mousse qui disparait. Nez boisé, chocolat, légèrement fumé.Gout fumé, chocolat, boisé avec notes légère de levures et épices en fin de bouche. Bon corps. Fin avec bonne amertume grillée et boisée. Superbe!

Bottle 50cl traded with Nisse666 thanks. A cloudy amber beer with huge head. Nose is caramel and yeast, light spices. Aroma is on caramel, toasted grain, smoked notes, yeast, cinnamon, sweet, spices, peated too, robust body quite sweet. Spicy finish.

Bottle @ The Tasting Room. Aroma of roasted malts, some smoked notes, citrus, caramel. Dark amber, clear, off white head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, tastes of dark dried fruits, grains, dark caramel, smoked notes, some sour notes. Medium body, good mouthfeel, average carbonation. The smoke is not overwhelming, wich makes this beer drinkable. Pairs well with blue cheese!

Bottle. Thanks to Wiosna. Amber body tan head. Aroma is dried fruits with malts and hints of almonds. Taste is some smoke malts with caramel and dried fruits. Aftertaste smoke with malts and nice bitterness. Nice and very balanced.

0,5 l pullo @ Ottakringer Brauerei. Samea karamellinruskea. Tuoksussa paahteista mallasta, vähän savua. Maussa jännää pyöreyttä. Paahteista mallasta, ruisleipää, makeutta, limppua. Hväähän tämä on, tuoksusta en vaan tykännyt.

500ml bottle at Brauwerk Tasting bought in 2014 in Norway. Bottled 03/2014, BB 03/2016. brown cloudy color, small tan head. smells smoky, leather, spices, light fruits, light currant notes, creamy. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes smoky, ash, berry, nice roast notes, spices, light sweetness, milky, light leather, light bacon. finishes with smoky, roast, light ash, quite creamy. wow, great lovely creamy / roasty taste. love it.

Batch 801. Best before: 2016-10-27. ABV: 6.5% 

Clear mahogny colored. A two finger high, beige, head. 

Nose: Smoke, campfire, ash, soap, charcuteries, dried fruit, oak and meat. 
 Taste: Roasted malt, burned sugar, ash, dark fruit, smoke, nuts and grapefruit. 
Body: A medium body. High carbonation. Dry, bitter finish. 

If you like smoked beer and especially Aecht Schlenkerla you got to love this!

Bottle. Amber colour. Aroma smoke (I suppose that birch), some fruity tones - maybe apricot. Taste is smoky, caramel, fruity. Overcarbonated - this is, for me, the only mínus of this beer - i think this is attenuating the intensity of taste. Otherwise very good beer.

Deep amber hue. Stable low foam. Wonderful smoky aroma
 Not so pleasant taste. sour to my taste and quite flat. Unpleasant finish ful of unfit cocolate.

It has a very good aroma of smoke and forest, but the taste is horrible. I had hoped for acidity from juniper, a good deal of smoke and maybe a little bitter dark chocolate to round it all. In the taste there is a little smoke to start with and then its otherwise sour. Not in the wild fermented or brett-like manner and not in a way that I think that its infected, because I believe that it is the brewerys opinion it should be like this.

Clear copper, orange cream head
Bread well cooked crust, barrell wood, mature fruit, smocked sausace, caramel, cherry barrell
Smoked sausage, wood, juniper berries (if you know that they used them, you can find that taste), sweet malts
Wooden, juniper aftertaste
Perfectly balanced and tasteful beer

Bottle. Pours deep amber, nice white head. In aroma toasted malts, campfire smoke and bacon notes. In taste sweet, malty, smokiness on lower level than in aroma. Medium bodied, medium bitter finish. Very good, nicely smoked beer.

Dark amber and initially ever so slightly hazy, but when poured with all the yeast sediments, it becomes opaque and muddy. Head is light honey in colour, 2 fingers tall and leaves a decent lacing despite not being the most durable. Aroma has a sweetish malty base, but the smoked malts dominate everything with a smoked ham aroma. Hints of bread, juniper berries, wood and smoked prunes also make an appearance. The yeast sedimants add a slightly yeasty aroma in the very end. Taste is bonfire smoke that persists in the aftertaste as well. Initially sweetish, but goes to rather dry in the finish. Bready almost like a Bock. Bitterness is low to medium in strength. Medium bodied, very carbonated. A really satisfying beer. If only your regular Rauchbock tasted and smelled like this, I would be in a smoked beer heaven.

Batch 364. Pours a clear medium amber with distinct garnet notes which, under bright light, approaches red. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Outstanding nose of campfire oak smoke, a hint of bacon and a touch of yeast.

Medium bodied with a texture that approaches creamy. Superb carbonation with a nice effervescent burst in the middle and a nice prickly finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is intense, but lacks the rich meaty bacon complexity and balance (by being too heavy on the oak smoke) when compared to world class Aecht Schlenkerla. It begins with oak smoke and a bit of juniper bitterness. As these fade in the middle, bacon and caramel take the forefront, but just barely. The finish is a slow fade of smoke and juniper.
Rood bruine kleur. Mooie dikke schuimkraag. Zoetbittere, rook smaak. Ruikt fris en bitter. Apart en lekker.
Clear red-brown color with a little foam layer. Light smokey smell. Crisp, but too foamy carbonation. Smokey appleish barrel flavors. The aftertaste is a little malty and smokey.
Amber color with beige head. Smokey bacon, juniper berries, wood, malts, caramel. Nice mouthfeel, great balance. Wow!
Bottle at SinH4s Goodbye Event. Innocent malty nose, but a very sweet and strong juniper taste. Beautiful!

Att inte väcka uppmärksamhet, det är en konst som det militärindustriella komplexet plöjer ned miljardtals dollar i för att bemästra. Avancerad smyg- och kamouflageteknik är avgörande för krigslyckan. Om Norwegian Wood vore en underjordisk forskningsenhet i Nevadaöknen hade de varit först med prototypen till en osynlighetsmantel. För det är vad det här ölet är: ett oidentifierat objekt som inte kan uppfattas med blotta sinnena.

A nice smoky beer. Pours a beautiful red with a thick tan head. Smells of marshmallow, coffee, smoky wood and a hint of vanilla. Taste is smoky, juniper berries throughout, bitter coffee and marshmallow in the finish. Nice and complex. Had in the bottle.

Clear dark amber/ruby colour with big but quickly collapsing head. Intensive aroma of caramel fudge and full of peaty and woody note. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, with smoke, wood and some ham. Quite easy to drink.

Piwo ma barwę mocnej herbaty i jest mętne, a na górze utworzyła się bardzo ładna czapa piany. Zapach jest raczej płaski i dominuje w nim wędzona szynka oraz wyraźny i mi nie pasujący jałowiec. W smaku jest już znacznie lepiej i ciekawiej. Piwo jest pełne i gęste. Wędzonka gra pierwsze skrzypce balansując między szynką a dymem ogniska. Żaden jałowiec jałowo nie zakłóca mi odbioru. Jest tak smaczne i pijalne, jak tylko może być.

Bottle, bb 5.05.2016, batch 745. Copper-coloured, hazy beer with tall white head. Aromas of smoke, dried fruits, spices/herbs. Taste is quite sweet, with marked bitterness, some herbal notes as well. Lively carbonated, medium bodied. Very good, complex and interesting beer. Highly recommended.

Old rating rerated 14.04.2015, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry and smoked, co2 stinging in the nose, weeds, shed, leafs, pine needles, caramel malts, horse blanket, grass, yeast, hints of bacon. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, wet grass, minerals, shed, leafs, caramel malts, hay, nuts, yeast, burnt caramel, pine needles, bark. Medium bitterness, slightly fizzy mouthfeel. Nice enough, but it used to be better before...

May 23, 2015. Bottle at home, batch #801, best before october 27, 2016. 
Clear dark amber with a large frothy off-white head. Aroma is smoked wood, juniper, toffee, herbal and earthy. Taste is light to medium sweet malty with dry herbal and earthy bitterness with smokey notes. Finish is light dry herbal with smoked wood and light malty sweetness. Medium bodied, quite fizzy carbonation.
500ml bottle, many thanks to Gunnar! Pours a deep amber with thick off-white head. Aroma is smoked malts. No juniper detected, but a lovely smooth smoked beer nonetheless.

pours hazy, tea color, medium, hissing head falling down to nil. Aroma of smoke, smoke, and malt. Very nice. Juniper (if it is juniper, because it is not stated in ingredients. Only hops) is sensible in taste giving a sour, dry, fruity note. High carbonation boost sourness even more. Fruity and smoky aftertaste. Interesting brew, but a bit unbalanced IMO. And I would expect better appearance from beer refermented in the bottle, "traditional ale" is no excuse.
Flaska. Oklar bärnstensfärgad öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av karamell, citrus, russin, torv och läder. Smakinslag av torv, karamell, läder och malt. Medel mot stor kolsyra. Rökig eftersmak.

Traditional Norwegian ale. 6.5%. A nice copperish, brown color. Slightly hazy. Medium, tan, head. Smells sweet and alluring! Some smoke tones, and some herb like structures. The juniper comes through well in the taste. Having brewed with juniper myself, I think this is well done, the sweetness balances the juniper in your mouth. Not smoke though. Watery finish. Easy to drink, but juniper makes for a special kind of beer.

Pours brown with tall head. Very high in CO2 due to (planned!) bottlefermention. Liquid is cloudy woth some visible sediment. Beautiful deep and rich malt with a light smoke aroma. I get hints of juniper. Tasting less smoky than expected but still distinct. Just a hint of juniper and spruce and a dark rich malt as a base with dried fruit and liquorice. I like the style and this is a very nice beer. Nothing for the "beer beginner" though.

0,5l bottle from Flesland. Light brown, caramel head, tall. A "Belgian" aroma. Aroma also has some lovely yeast, ripe fruit, and a slight hint of licorice. Tastes somewhat like a mild stout. Smoky, licorice, but also ripe fruits and yeast. Like a mix of stout and blonde, or stout and "mild" abbey double. More than decent.
Overall: Sweet smoked fruits, vigorous bubbles. Dry finish.Note: Bottle 500 ml at home. Reviewed 2015-03-18.

50 cl. bottle. Hazy, amber colour with golden hues and a dense, lightly tanned head. Sweet aroma with smoked malts, caramel, fruits, juniper berries, spices, ashes and an earthy note. Some spruce adding bitterness. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture and a fine, lively carbonation. Lasting smoked, slightly drying finish with a good juniper berry fruitiness and toasted malts. Odd, but well balanced and this beer is gaining attraction as the bottle empties. A good experience if youre looking for something special.

From 500ml bottle. Redish brown with one thinger thick beige head fading to leave a small lid and some lacing. Aroma of peat, saussagy smoke and juniper. Similar flavor but also with crisp bread and a fresh berry finish.

Pours clear brown with low off white head
Aromas of german sausage, hints of smoke, caramel
Taste has nice caramel malty backbone, charcuteries, smoke, wood

This beer pours a murky brown color with a with a large off-white head that fades somewhat quickly, and the aroma has a lot of smoke and wood fire with some hints of juniper berries floating underneath the predominate flavors. The taste is full of as much smoke as the aroma, and its highly umami and a touch sour; basically, it tastes like wood fire smells through the initial flavor and the aftertaste. The palate fuses a slick texture, medium body, and a lively carbonation.

Barwa: miedziana, lekko zmętniona.
Piana; bardzo obfita, kremowa, drobno i średniopcherzykowa, dość trwała.
Zapach: bardzo intensywny, słodowy, aromaty karmelu, toffi. Wędzonka bardzo przyjemna z lekkimi nutami palonymi, drzewnymi jak i słodowymi. W tle wyczuwalne nuty jałowca i owoców.
Smak: dokładnie wszytko to co w aromacie, solidna baza słodowa z nutami karmelu i toffi skontrowana ciekawą goryczką. Ma ona na początku palony charakter przechodzący w lekko ziołowy.
Wysycenie: wysokie, mogło by być niższe.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear dark reddish brown color with nice white head. Armoa of smoke, blood and ham. The taste is fantastic, cured meats, sausages, bacon, nuts, oil, slightly acidic, medium bitterness. Fresh aftertaste of wild berries. Very, very good.

Cloudy brown liquid with a big off-white head. Smoked ham, herbs, dark sugar and hints of metal in the aroma. The taste is sweet yet somewhat dry and a little sour with some lingering bitterness in the aftertaste. Low but slightly fizzy carbonation, medium body. Kind of messy, but I still kind of love it.

From bottle in English pint glass. Poured with decent head that settled quickly. Juniper berries contribute nicely to nose and complement the smokey notes for a broad taste. Stirred my Norwegian genes.

Pours chestnut brown with a finger of thin head. The aroma has an immediately obvious smoky touch to it, but not as dominant as in a typical Bamberg Rauchbier. It does smell old wood, like in a traditional woodburning sauna with wooden furnishings, walls and inner roof which has been subject to intense heat and moisture for decades. There's also a hint of herbs, licorice and roasted whole grains. The palate is almost more smoky than the nose. Medium bodied, fairly well balanced with a touch of sweetness and acidity. Lingering wood smoke and smoked fish on the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lund SB saluhallen, flaska. Rökt rökt frisk åt citron banan. Fin grummel . Som en belgare. Fin krona vitgul. Läskande och fyllig smak. Men dyr i Sverige 44:- pust...
Bottle at home. Pours hazy coppr amber, taste is almost sickly sweet up front with a smoky finish.
bottle. copper and fizzy. aroma of caramel and smoked malts. medium body, lightly sweet and medium bitter and lots of smoke. and it stays for while...

Aroma: spicy, fruity, juniper, malty, roasty, smoky, complex

Sampled from a 50cl bottle purchased at duty-free at Gardermoen. Dark reddish brown colour with a foaming cream-white head. If all rauchbiers were as good as this, I would seek it out more often. Another excellent beer from the brewers at Haandbryggeriet.

(Brewed April 2013)
Wonderful, medium deep copper colour, with a rich faoamy head, lasting 3-5 minutes.

Interesting beer, recommended with food (e.g. rich, salty, nordic winter and Christmas dishes).

Bottle from Gunnar - many thanks to you for this gem! The beer has got a deep dark brown, light blackish colour with a steady head and medium to smooth body. Aroma of malt, peat and torf. Very special and very quaffable, a beer to enjoy.

Poured from 500mL bottle [batch 432]. Murky light medium brown with dissipating beige head. Smoke, burnt wood, bitter juniper berries come through subtlety. Subdued flavour, not much of a finish.

(50 cl bottle from Heinemann Gardermoen; Batch #745; Bottled on May 5th 2014; BBD: May 5th 2016) Pours a hazy dark amber with three-finger tan head that lasts a while. Nice lace. 500 ml bottle from Les Vignerons (Batch 596 22-04-2013). Light amber/copper, hazy and murky looking, with a big, fluffy, creamy and persistent off white head. Khyber Pass. Hazy caramel copper pour. Off-white head. Not much lace. Smoked ham hocks. Charcoal grill. Peat. Leather. Cigarettes. Silky body. 500ml bottle poured into Schlenkerla pint...! Pours a hazy copper with suspended particles, and with a finger-thick off-white head. Aroma is of juniper berries, medium-light smoke with a nutty malt backbone following right after. Taste has a tad of sweetness to it, medium-light bitterness, and some light tartness. Aftertaste is relatively bitter, as if the smoky aromas were "shifting into bitterness". Body is medium with a slightly slick texture. Carbonation is just a bit over average. Finish is medium. Overall, a pretty unique offering in the realm of "smoked beers". In fact Im a bit puzzled because I wasnt expecting that at all...! This is far from being the smokiest of all, and its not necessarily a flaw; its just that Im more into "Schlenkerla-ish" Rauchbiers. Still, a very good offering that I would drink again from time to time.
Noe overkarbonert eksemplar, men ikke fatalt. Middels smokey, med fine toner av karamell og skinke. Overraskende lettdrikkelig.

Bottle. Dark mysky brown with big off white head. Aroma: nice smokey, ham, juniper berries, earthy, smells good! Taste: nice toasted caramel with some smokey meat mixed with juniper berries. This is highly enjoyable if you ike smoked brews =).

nice smooth roasty note, a round smoke aroma, like a mellow smoked porter. hazy medium amber/dark honey color, with a generous rocky head. the flavor yields a soft smoke note with a mild roastiness. theres reasonable bitterness that builds in the finish. slightly tangy quality.

50cl bottle. Large off white yellow head. Sparkling with small bubbles. Hazy blood orange juice color. Aroma is rowan berries, yeast, lemon zest and licorice with a iron touch. Flavour is smoked malt with hay and yeast.

Cloudy red/brown pour with a thick tan head. Really unique aroma, smoked malts mainly. I was surprised to get some of the citrus notes you find from an American IPA. Piney flavors, likely from juniper, along with smoke. Like many beers with smoked malts there is a pleasant lingering smoky aftertaste. A bit too much fizziness makes it somewhat harsh, but the overall mouthfeel is fairly nice.

16 oz bottle labelled Batch 888, $12 (!).

Bottle from 2010.
Aroma is fairly smokey with nice juniper note but not much malt character. Light sweet caramel note with hints of toffee.
Pours a dark copper with some light brown and ruby highlights. Light tan head of moderate retention but it recedes steadily. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet upfront but then the smoke hits to mellow out the sweetness. Light toffee and caramel notes with hints of raisin and other fruit. Juniper is light and the finish has just a hint of acidity. Light bitterness to help balance the sweetness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency an low alcohol warmth. 
Overall an alright beer and fairly unique. The smoke and juniper are well balanced but with the age the malt character has kind of faded out. The light acidity is nice an doesn't overwhelms but instead only adds a touch of tartness in the background. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brunorange grumlig öl med smutsvitt skum. Doft av trä, enris och en behaglig rökighet. Trä, balanserad rökighet och en bra maltighet i smaken. Smakar inte enbären (vilket för mig är positivt).

Light rusty brown with a good sized off-white head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is juniper, straw, brown sugar, hints of smoke and leather. Slight creaminess on the mouthfeel, hint of background malty sweetness with a lot of wood and tannin on the palate, a hint of smoke and a dry mineral finish. Taste is malt, dates, juniper, cedar, chicory root. Interesting.

500 ml bottle shared with czar - thanks, mate. Pours a sediment-filled orangeish amber with a nice white head. Aroma is smoked and wood. Flavor is fruity (red berries) and barley. Finish is malty, dry, woody, smokey. Lingering wood. Light to medium body, weak to average carbonation, soft mouthfeel. Good.
Reddish amber appearance with an active head. Smells of wood, smoke, and barbeque. The best smoked beer i have ever had, balanced light spice and sweet layered into a medium body smokey excellence.
Bottle at Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Originally rated 09122011. Colour is hazy amber with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Wood, smoke, sweetness and malts.

pours unclear medium brown reddish with a decent off-white head, some retention and lacing. fruity and peppery junipers, almost lagered fruitiness, nice complex and smoked malts - never umami, hint of minerals and maple. average carbonation, light body, smoky-grassy finish. nicely done.
Enbär? Känner inget av det. Men sitter ute på konser så det stör ju lite. Lite subtil rauchbier känner man. Passar säkert bra till gamla ost.

Pours an extremely cloudy golden orange color with a light taupe, bumpy head. Aroma is somewhere among coal, peat, and campfire smoke with some Belgian spice breaking through. Soda pop fizzy mouthfeel, which does not pair well with the obtrusive smoky flavors. The flavors dominated by the extraordinary smokiness. Some sweet fruit is embedded in there. As the beer sits, the mouthfeel settles and the beer blends better. Still quite fizzy though.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Colour is dark amber, with a big head that remains for a few minutes. Aroma is smoke and wood, maybe some spices too. Medium on the palate, and a strong smoked flavour, with some malty sweetness. Not too heavy, actually a quite pleasant smoky beer.

Hazy dark amber colour, small tan head. Great smoky aroma with a hints of tar. Just like firewood. Very rich and enjoyable taste. Taste has light bitterness to it and it almost feels a bit salty. Theres also a bit of juniper. On the palate it starts tingly but then becomes very soft.
I think this is a very good ale with good smoky flavour.
GCB: This is what beer used to taste like. Very interesting and complex ale.

Bottle - 500ml. Hazy amber body with a thick, lasting white foamy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with strong smokey hints. Its robust taste carries smokey and wildberries notes. Ends with a long bitter/smokey finish. well done.

500ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Smoky, bacon aromas. Pours dark amber, some hazy, with nice off-white head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is smoky, some sweet flavours. Quite enjoyable.

First thing that hit me, was that this smelled of burnt wood. Nice white foam. Was expecting a heavier beer, but would say this is light bodied, with heavy crystal malt flavour. Smoky aftertaste, quite pleasant.

Pleasant pour though a little bubbly. Nice color and aroma that warns you of the impending smokiness. Agree with another rater that the taste stays with you for hours. Thankfully it is not an unpleasant taste.
Fin mørk gyllen farve med beige skum som ligger. Lukt av bek og røyk. Fruktig smak kombinert av tunge smaker av malt, bek og røyk. Vinmonopolet.

Pours amber, some off-white head. Nose is grassy, woody. Flavour has more bitterness than expected, some juniper, nice maltiness. Smoke comes in at the end and really lasts for hours. Nice to try, I enjoyed drinking this, but it could never be a regular beer. Would be nice around a campfire.

0,5 Bottle from Madlatorget Vinmonopol. Hazy orange color with thick offwhite head. Light roasted aroma off smoke with some fireplace notes too it. Also some hoppy notes there. Nice roasted smokeyflavor that balance really nice with a easy burnt oaky maltness and nice hoppy bitterness. Finishes off pretty dry and hoppy. Love the balance on the smokeyness.

Dark murky orange amber, med head. Smells..kiln fired malts smells just like that, real bush fire smokey malts, caramel, berry fruit and some spice. Tastes..smokey malts, kind of spicy and caramel, some juniper hints. Really nice.
Bottle. Color hazy dark amber with medium brown head. Aroma sweet, smoke, wood, caramel. Taste smoke, wood, bitter, malt, caramel.
Pours hazy brown with a medium tan head. A little smoky, a little herbal, a little spicy, and a touch a fruit. Whats not to like?

On the bottle it describes this as a recreation of an ancient Norwegian farm beer with the taste of smokey wood. Ill make a long story short; it tastes like beer mixed with hickory sticks.  Or possibly hotdogs.  Must be an acquired taste.. to each their own.
ivory white head that disappears quickly. clear amber coloured beer. pronounced smoke aroma with some hops. very smokey flavour.batch #451 / bottle 50cl / notes from backlog

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 Use by 12.01.12. Opened 19.04.13
Dark muddy brown beer with a brief beige head. Smoked ham and red berries on the nose. Smoked ham and roasted coffee in the flavor. Some coffee bitterness in the after taste. I think this has lost some of its sweetness over time. Still quite good but I think its better when fresh. 

Use by 02.02.13 Opened 29.4.13. A LOT better than what described above. Sweeter and a lot nicer brew with a twist of anise in the flavor. A lovely beer.
Et godt og friskt øl.  Gir en god og rik smaksopplevelse og munnfølelse.  Et øl jeg gjerne prøver igjen.

Color is a cloudy rich caramel topped with a sturdy light tan head. Floral smell is the most apparent affect of the added juniper. Scents of wood, peat and bacon are apparent. Full-bodied without being too heavy or thick. Tastes earthy and very bitter with the juniper being a. Charred beef, yeast and cinnamon also show through. A great beer if your tastes run to dry or spicy beers, like ryes.

Bottle shared at beers of the world.  Aroma of smoked meats, cream, and juniper spice.  Pours light red with a nice film.  Taste has great smoke notes without being overbearingly faux bacon.  A nice tart orange peel taste blends nice with the juniper berry and smoke.  Very pleasant and unique.  I highly recommend people try this.

So unusual and so awesome. Hickory smoke on the nose, berries and chocolate on the palate, and a touch of anise (I think that comes from the juniper twigs) on the dry finish. This beer lingers forever and keeps adding complexity.
This is seriously smoky. It pours a dark cloudy brown with a fairly big head. It has a lot of taste going on. This is nearly as good as the Yeastie boys smoky beer. Nearly.

Pours a hazy amber/ruby color with a thin off white head.  Aroma has note of spruce and smoked berries or fruit.  Flavor is smoky with notes of wood, fruit/berries, and a faint sprucey note.  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is smoky/fruity/woody and earthy bitter/dry.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090705.
Pours murky amber color with a medium sized head. Aroma of juniper, herbal notes, malts, some ripe fruits and caramel. Flavor of yeast, juniper, malts, some fruity notes and spices. Excellent.
Poured from a 500 ml bottle, thanks to Santa. Smokey, fruity, grainy,soft smoke flavor. A really great balance.

Bottled 0,50L. Dark brown color, much fraught and hazy aspect, discreet bubbly presence, strong head duration. Complex and alcoholic nose, notes of burned wood, smoked malt, cellar, resin and cortex. Very solid and round taste, singed wood and cereals notes, much elevated alcoholic impact, much round and livelt mouth. Little rumors of leather and long sweetish and crisp final.

Et av mine første møter med øl dominert av røykmalt før jeg visste hva dett er, på Pingvinen i Bergen for noen år siden. Superspennende og utfordrende, men etter at den første begeistringen hadde lagt seg vokste det mer og mer i munnen på meg, og det var som å sittte midt inne i et fuktig bål. Siden den tid har jeg hatt problemer med rauchbier, selv om jeg prøver og prøver...

500 ml bottle. Pours a clear light mahogany with medium head of big bubbles. Aromas of wood smoke, transmission fluid, citrus, and brown sugar. Flavors of hickory smoke, apples, toasted malts and light citrus/berries. Quite nice.

500ml bottle, Not a great sight, poured a murky amber with minimal head. Aroma was way better, obviously smoke, but complex, with some spicy and earthy notes. Taste strikes a remarkable balance, an peculiar tart side and a lasting dry finish, slightly astringent. Original and interesting.
Lovely reddish brown colour. Aroma is smoked meat. Taste is surprisingly smooth. Continuous smokeyness. But not much else going on aside from this. Pretty tasty, with a good finish.

500 mil bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. Clear deep ruby-copper with a nice light tan head. Meat smoke that is kept in check by rich, caramel/toffee maltiness, some nice fruitiness, not getting any juniper, campfire, I like it. Medium+ body with soft, somewhat sparse effervescence. Less smoke than the nose, more frity and less caramel/toffee, a bit of old apple juice, not quite as interesting as the aroma; dry with limited bitterness and a fairly long, kinda fruity and slightly weak finish with only a touch of smoke. Strong start, less strong finish.

50cl Bottle @ Oslo. Hazy brown coloured beer with some medium carbonation and a medium diminishing off white head. Very strong roasted smokey light herby woody aroma. Very strange. Full light creamy smokey palate. Finish is bitter herby smokey woody. Very strange brew.

Excellent. Pours a cloudy brown with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is woody, smoke, a little fruit and some caramel. Taste is smokey, some brown sugar, a bit of fruit, some vanillas. What makes this beer wonderful, aside from having been brewed by Haandbryggeriet, is the specificity of the smoke. This isnt a big, overpowering bacony smoke, but a wonderful, aromatic, wood fire smoke. Its like this beer came straight off of the fire. Again, excellent.

(50 cl bottle) Hazy, brown beer with a creamy yellow(ish) head and some chunky sediment. Aroma is moderately smoky, along with licorice, woo, moss. The juniper berries are present, but less dominant than expected, and seem to bring a more fruity touch to the whole thing. Still makes associate pinewood forests and heathlands. Nearly burnt sugar. Medium bitterness, slightly sweet and sour. Medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation. Almost creamy texture. Overall a good mouthfeel. Well balanced, alcohol well-hidden. Complex enough, but not too exhausting/demanding. Recommended!

Bottle shared by Dallas, thanks 
Appearance: Clear golden iwith a medium sized off-white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Smokey and woody 
Taste: Smokey, grainy, malts and mild spices 
This was nice, with the right amount of smokiness to be enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Orange, cloudy, tan head. Aroma of grainy malt, moderate smoke, fresh-baked dark bread, light leather note. Flavor very similar, grainy malt, smoke, bread crusts, biscuit, a little earthy character, very nice balance, not too smoky. Only the barest hint of juniper--wouldnt notice if I hadnt read that its in there. It contributes a subtle note to a very nice interesting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Juniper and toffee malt aroma.  Dark amber with minimal head.  Sweet caramel malt and strong juniper flavor.  Peaty smoke finish.  "They have brought forth juniper berries!"

Looked a bit sloppy  - like foam not coming out too well. Great aroma - hay and smoke and when i tasted the juniper came out - like when I chew on a juniper berry (or drink genever). Not too sweet, so great with food. I had it with cured  "Sik"  (Coregonus lavaretus ) from Røros and some eggs. Best smoked beer so far - much more complex taste than the German ones Ive tasted before.

Dark brown color with a slight cream colored head. Aroma of raisin, pitch, and smoke. Flavors also reminiscent of raisin, but with a moderate acidity from the smoke. Medium bodied with a slight carbonic bite. Very good beer.

Bottle: batch 432 of 2160 total bottles
Pours dirty brown/amber with a tall, thick, yellow-tan head.
Heavy sediment.
Aroma is smoke, ham/bacon, malt.
Taste is fruit, sharp....with smoky accents...
Remarkably dry...mild bitter juniper...
Beautiful balance.
A great beer.
Bottle. Fruity, wood smoke aroma. Hazy amber with a large beige head. Smoky malt, slightly meaty, caramel, and light spicy flavor. Medium body, , moderate carbonation.

Clear amber with foamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet with light smoke and notes of yeast, pine and caramel. Taste is dry with mild smoke, spices, black peppercorn. Dry medium bitter finish with lingering smoke.

Bottle: Poured a dark amber color ale with a large dirty white foamy head with good retention and some light lacing notes. Aroma consists of smoked malt with some light tart fruit notes. Taste is a complex mix between some tart fruit notes with some smoked malt with light dry caramel malt notes. Body is about average with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Well put together and quite original.

Dark amber with a creamy tan head fading quickly. Nice mix of aromas that swings between smoke ham, pine needles and something fruity like blueberries or elderberries.  Light to medium body, suitable carbonation, very light smokiness wich I like, finishing on a light cocoa and lager-like ending. Very nice beer.
Way too heavy on the smoky tastes and aromas. I dont like this type of beer at all, but I suspect this one to match salty food well. Sorry, this is not my favourite.

Hazy amber colour with a tan head. Smoked and fruity aroma. Medium to full body. A bit oily texture. Lot of smoked malt in the flavour. Also a lot of caramel malt and some fruity notes. Ok with smoked salomon.[Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Fredrikstad, Norway]

Pours a cloudy amber color with a medium tan head. Nice aroma of wood, smoked malt and fruits. The flavor is smoky, woody and fruity, its very interesting. The body is medium to full with a creamy, slightly oily texture and moderate carbonation. This is really good, its almost as good as the Beatles song.

500 ml. bottle. Batch 432. Total bottles 2160. Pours a thick light beige, well retained head, over a cloudy, particle laden amber (SRM 15) body....nose is light smoke, very light brown sugar, light toffee/caramel, bread......taste is smoke, bread, light toffee/caramel, dry throughout, finishing with medium hop bitterness......mouth feel light of medium, slight astringent, carbonation low. This beer is nicely balanced between the smoke, malt and hop backbones. The smoke was done lightly, but is definitely present on what is essentially a Brown Ale. The only flaw is the particle laden appearance. BJCP 7/2/14/4/7

Bottle. Clear amber with a big foamy beige head that quickly fizzes out. Aroma of smoke, spicy juniper and rye bread. Flavor is smoky with bitter spice, malt and light alcohol. Medium body with prickly carbonation. Not bad, the spice and smoke go together fairly well.

[Thanks to Cunningham]. 50cl bottle. Oranish colour with a formation of an off white head, medium lasting maintaining a thin layer, nice lacing. Aroma is smoky and malty. Flavor is malty, with a medium smokiness but also sweet and caramel notes. The final is light bittery with wooden notes. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high.

I bought this even though it was 2 years past the "Bested by" date (bottled in 2008).  I was intrigued by the promise of juniper and smoke. Bottle pour to shaker; drank with a meal of pork loin. Smoky aroma; big smoky taste and . . . mmm, bacon!  This beer paired nicely with the meal; I enjoyed the experience.

Bottle in trade from Suttree. Thanks! Hazy coppery amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, wood, juniper and other herbs, and bread. Taste is woody, herbal, and a little spicy, smokey, a little sweet, and somewhat bitter. Good stuff.

Style et résumé:  Bière traditionnel aromatisée à la baie de genévrière et brassée avec du malt fumé. 
Comment:  Bouteille de 500ml. de la batch 408 brassée le 30.09.11 et meilleure avant le 30.09.13 achetée via les Importations Privées Bieropholie. 
Description: Cette bière est cuivrée avec une belle couche de mousse beige. Le nez est surprenant  avec des arômes de vomi. Il y a de la fumé. La bière prend beaucoup de place en bouche. La mousse est crémeuse. Il y a un goût fruité, serait-ce cette maudite levure. Le boisée est bien intégré parmi un léger côté fumé. Pas trop souvent !! 
Note:  5+/10

Bottle (best by date sometime in 2010)...  Poured muddy brown with a moderate, khaki head.  This was nice.  Wow!  Some lasting smoke tones with herbs, botanicals, and dark fruits.  Some worty malt for balance too.  Total pleasure to drink.

Bottle from Mansfield. A murky reddish-brown brew. Thick tan head. Aroma is nice and smoky, with a slight bit ot tartness. Flavor is smoky and tangy-fruit. Interesting. First few sips were surprising, but I got used to it. Flavors hard to describe. Besides the smoke that rules, there is some sweetness and spice. Very earthy. Medium body. Lingering smokiness.

Really interesting beer; murky brown with some decent lacing.  Smoky full bodied and rich.  Very unique; not an everyday beer for me but very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place.Thanks DSG. Cloudy brown honey colour, tan film. Smokey and fruity at once, honey undertones. Bitter and a little roasty. Smokey finish, medium body, soft texture and a little burning in the finish. Nice.
Keg @Rake bar, London - Pours dark amber with a thin head. Smoky/spicey malt complex taste that does not disappoint. Impressive.

Bottle sample.
Murky light brown / deep amber color with a small beige head.
Roasted almonds, must, smoke, wood and gin on the nose.
Malty flavors, with light fruits, medium bitterness, smoke and nuts.
Med-full body, low carbonation, good and complex.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks KnutAlbert for this bottle! Slightly hazy deep orange- amber color with a medium beige head. Aroma of smoked meat, some wood, malt, caramel and spicy notes. Rather sweet flavor, smoky, with some wood, malt, caramel, light honey-ish hints and a drier finish, smoky and a bit spicy. Medium-bodied. Silky rounded mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Bottle. Nice red body, off-white head. Light sweet coffee and smokey aroma, a little chocolate too. Flavour of coffee and smoke, which is is a little like the smell of sea and wooden boats and sea weed. Light sweet finish. (At home, 22.09.2010)

50cl bottle. It pours a burnt orange-caramel colour with a big egg shell head. Aroma is caramel, smoke and red berries. Some dust and medicinal spice, but in a good sense. Taste is similar in terms of flavours. Mostly sweet with a touch of acidic from the berries and little bitterness from the smoke. Mouthfeel is pretty slick with good carbonation. Overall, fantastic brew with tons of flavour for 6.5% ABV. And the smoke is just in the perfect quantity and blended great with the berries.
Keg at PSBH, 30th August 2012.  This is good, nice smooth beer and good level of smoke, nice to savour this one.

Bottle @ home. Pours hazy orange with a huge offwhite head. Aroma of malt, nice light smoke, bacon, berries. Flavor of malt, bacon, light smoke, berries. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very nice smoked beer. 010912

Got the dregs in my pour which clouded this up quite considerably. Still, a formidable smoke aroma that is incredibly long lasting. This is smoky and a bit woody and yet its not really what a was hoping for, is the best way to put it. Really good but still just not my favorite smoked.

Bottle, batch 432. Pours hazy amber, with a big creamy head receding to laces. Aroma is oaky wood and lumber, as well as a spicy smokiness, berries and tobacco. Fairly normal body and carbonation. Flavour is sweet with syrup and liquorice, and notes of fruit and berries together with burned malt. Finishes of with a bittersweet caramelly burned sugar and syrup.

Une bouteille de 50 cl.  Batch 408.  Meilleure avant le 30.09.13.  Une robe brune ambrée et sa spectaculaire et solide coiffe beige.  Une dentelle qui semble bien vouloir sinstaller.  Un nez fumé par le bois et touché par un souffle de terre caramélisée.  Un aspect fruité et des baies de genièvre qui émettent un commentaire épicé.  Des saveurs intéressantes.  Des malts grillés qui ne sont jamais trop doux.   De la fumée parfumée par le bois dur mais aussi par le sapin.  Des petites baies dont les flaveurs me rappellent certains plats slaves.  Une intrusion des houblons qui contribuent à une stratégie dassèchement.  Une sensation en bouche qui me plaît sans me ravir totalement.  Un corps de moyenne densité avec un bon apport de bulles.  Une texture légèrement huileuse.  Une finale boucanée et amère de houblons.  Une dégustation appréciable.

Bottle from a trade with Palme. Brown with a frothy head of medium sustain. Woody, bonfire smokiness rules the aroma, with a strong fruity note, some caramel and a tiny bit of hops. There seems to be some juniper in the background, though I expected it to be more prominent. Solid body, smoked flavour skilfully combined with caramel, light sweetness countered by a rather strong bitterness. There is some juniper in the aftertaste, joining a berry-like fruitiness. Hearty beer with a somewhat fatty mouthfeel some smoked beers have. Very good!

pours a hazy amber with a foamy head which recedes quickly. lots of smoke in the aroma with a hint of juniper, farmhouse smoked ham with junipers is all going off in the flavour although a little overcarbonated. finishs sweet and smokey.

Aroma:mixe of juniper and smoke...
Appearance:hazy cooper,ligh head...
Flavor:juniper and smoke,light caramel...

Medium golden amber.  Beautiful looking with a generous head and light splashes of lace.  Toasted malt grows, adding light smoky field grasses;  lingers through a palate cleaning finish.  Best with strong meat (or at least good cheese).  Worth a look.
(Bottle 18/07-2012) Low beige head, unclear orange color, light smoked, slightly fruity taste. Brew date 09.01.2012, BB date 09.01.2014, batch #432.

Bottle from Barley Wine.
Pours dark amber with huge amounts of lively carbonation that leaves a 1 finger light brown head. 
Smells smoked, woody smoke and not the smoked meat/ham that some smoked beers have. In addition to the smoke it has sweet, piny notes, some caramel and malt.
Smooth mouth feel. Taste is smoky though the smoke does not take over hand as sweet, caramel taste is there as well. Some earthy notes which probably comes from the juniper berries. After a while, when the beer is less cold - some chocolate as well.  Smoked aftertaste. Interesting and nice!

A: This beer appears a medium to light copper hue with orange highlights. Upon popping the cap, the beer begins to ooze foam like a slow erupting volcano. The massive head eventually subsides, leaving a very stubborn 1/4 inch head with long lasting retention, yet no lacing.

S: A really complex aroma consisting of smoke, chocolate, candy, butterscotch, roasted malt, toffee.

T: The aroma is an accurate indicator of what flavors one might expect from this smoked beer. The smoke flavor is certainly apparent, though not as heavily pronounced as in most rauch beers. Overall, the beer is a bit sweet, with a tasty blend of butterscotch candies, toffee, and chocolate. The juniper berries are undoubtedly responsible for the floral / herbal flavors that contribute to the growing sweetness.

M: medium body with a sweet, somewhat sticky feel.

D: A tasty brew. I recommend sharing the bottle, as its better in small quantities.

500ml bottle, bottled 25.05.10, purchased at Groppis.  Pours a reddish brown color with a light tan head. Aroma is smokey, caramel, black Licorice.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, bready, smokey, a hint of the juniper berries, dark fruit, raisin, with a light smokey finish.  A lot of flavors going on here.  Pretty tasty.

Medium strong aroma has caramel, roasted toffee, dark fruits. Hazy brown, nice beige head long. Looks nice. Taste has french roast coffee, licorice, herbs, dark and ripe fruits. Medium body, slick and soft, standard carbonation, slightly roasted bitter, dries to medium lenght finish. Just caught this one before it was extracted from Alko; glad I did.
180712: Unclear orange color with a fine foam. Smoky scent. a little too ordinary ale taste but with good bonfire smoke notes.

Bottle, thanks to Palme, cheers!! Pours a hazy, dark orange colour with a small, off-white head. Smell is full of spices, juniper and has a malty background. Flavour is not quite what I expected, being nice and smokey with a spiced background. Very nice to drink this, being not too overcarbonated. Wow, this sure is a great surprise!!

50cl bottle at Parkteateret. Pours slightly hazy deep amber with a light brown head. Aroma of smoed wood, bonfire, caramel and a hint of juniper. Sweet, smoky and malty with a dry and bitter finish. Nice balance and lots of flavour. Smoky finish which gave me bonfire associations. Nice! (2012-07-09)

Bottled 5/25/2010, so this could be a bit old.   Smelled of caramel, toffee, smoked and roasted malt.  Poured a brownish red, with a ruby red tint up to the light.  Taste was an interesting mix between smoke/char/earthy/peaty flavors and sweetness, not sure if that could be the juniper or not.  Head stuck around for the whole glass, which was nice.  Once warmed up, the smoke taste was almost too much, my mouth almost tasted charred. Id try this again, but only if I could find a fresher bottle.  This was the type of beer I could smell and look at all day, but I wouldnt want more than one.
Pours hazy light brown with a slightly off white head. Aroma of smoky bacon, sweet malts. Reminds you of sitting at a campfire. Some caramel.
Smoke, licorice and hop. This is again a good beer from Norway. Im looking forward to taste something more from them.

Draught at Bishops Arms,
Slight hazy orangey. Aroma medium malty (caramel, notes of smoke, spicy of juniper berries). Flavor medium sweet and spicy, light smokey. Medium body.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Its January, Im cross country skiing in the Norwegian mountains, its cold, windy and snowing, but Im warm, due to my newly lit campfire. This high in the mountains its hard to find good, dry firewood, but some semi-dry pine branches with the needles still on do the job. The sour smoke aroma from the wet wood and the subtle resiny smoky notes from the burning pine needles mix with the smell of the sausages Im grilling. This is exactly what a Norwegian Wood smells like. Or, to be more precise, this is what a Norwegian Wood smells like 30 seconds after its been poured: in a freshly poured pint sweet fruity notes and sweet caramel dominate, but this initial aroma dies out quite rapidly and gives way to the smoky part. In addition I get tar, oil and wood. An unusual, complex and exciting aroma! The brew looks rather dull: a cloudy, medium amber to brown body, with a small off-white head that reduces to a thin layer very quickly, poor lacing. The taste is light sweet, light sour and the finish is medium bitter. A very long-lasting, medium bitter, smoky aftertaste. The flavours follow the aroma. Even though the smoke is the backbone of this ale, its never too much, its never intrusive, but its a mellow, nice and gentle smokiness. Pleasant mouthfeel with a medium body and soft to medium carbonation. A nice and exciting beer, Im glad Ive got one more in my beer cellar. So yes, John, I agree, Norwegian Wood is good.

Pours a nice copper colour with a very thick tan head. The aroma is sweet malts with a hint of smoke and fruit. The taste is very well balanced sweet malts and dry fruit with a nice smokey finish.

I once had a girl, or should I saw she once had me.50cL bottle.  Batch: 70.  Bottled Mar07, enjoy: Dec10.  Whoops, a bit old.  Pours muddy brown color.  Aroma of smoked meats. Tastes of smoked malts, hearty wood flavor, and sharp juniper bitterness.  Leaves a wooded smoke character on the palate.  Mmm, isnt it good? Norwegian Wood.

8,3,8,2,16
Very smoky, roasted, earthlike beer. Not my preferred style to drink. Smell scored high though!
This is a nice complex beer. The smokiness is subtle in both the aroma and taste. Good beer both not my style of choice.
Thanks to Quez..bottle poured into frosty pilsener glass...reddish copper color...notes of juniper and smoky wood malt...enjoyable

Bottle @Klooster, Delft with Kermis.
Good stable head.  Slightly hazy amber pour.  Notes of smoke & wood in the aroma.  Excellent

Bottle at Klooster.  Pours dark red brown with medium tan head.  Aroma is smoke, wood and nettles.  Flavor is smoky and fruity With spices and a roasty bitterness.  Body is soft with a low carbonation.  Good balanced beer.

(bottle)   Very rich creamy tan head with unfiltered foggy red/brown complexion.  Faint aroma of juniper, smoke and hops.  Predominant favor of smoke.  Creamy ale, rich in flavor.  More malt flavor than most ales. Uniquely homemade.

Pours a rich, foggy, striking, red with a small mountain of rocky head that lingers and lingers.  Aroma: smoke!  Something like pepper/cayenne in the background.  Taste: good.  Smoke character and rich maltiness battle it out giving it a great complexity.  Some warming alcohol slips in part way through.  Long, smoky finish - juniper starts to make an appearance.  The smoke in this is of such a woodsy-character is almost seems like its been aged in wood.  Its mostly a malt story, but theres enough hops to keep it from getting heavy.  Really great.  Surprising, enticing, rich, balanced.  Everything I like and more.

(bottle) Hazy, dark amber colour with a tall and slightly tanned foamy head. Moderately sweet and slightly dusty dark and smoke-malty aroma with notes of smoked bacon and light hints of juniper berries Bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied with a modest carbonation. Roasty and smoke-malty taste with crusty notes and burnt wood; quite bitter and roasty finish with smoke and burnt wood, with subtle notes of juniper, especially after burping. Good. 08.VII.11

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2011 This is the very first Norwegian beer I ever tried. Deep dark ruby color. Aroma of berries, juniper. This beer leaves an aftertaste of match, but its really pleasant. Not the usual smoked beer
500mL bottle, split with mcberko, pours dark reddish brown. Aroma of smoky malt, dark fruits, toffee and nuts. Flavour of butterscotch, wood, subtle dark fruits and smoke. Excellent.

Bottle.  Dark brown with a big foamy tanned head. Smoked aroma of wood, malt, some coffee, taste of juniper, barbeque, spices and campfire, really interesting complex taste. A shy bitterness matches the taste nice.

500mL bottle, split with Matts_Property, pours a dark reddish amber with a small head. Aroma is quite smoky, but not too overpowering, with dark fruits, caramel and toffee. Flavour brings butterscotch, wood, some fruitiness and subtle smoky characteristics. Most excellent.

Weicher, kurzzeitig muffiger Antrunk, der von milden Rauchnoten angeführt wird. Die geringfügige Fruchtigkeit verschwindet im Mittelteil weitestgehend, die Rauchigkeit schwindet ebenfalls. So besteht der Mittelteil nur noch aus einer dunklen Hefigkeit mit leichten Rauchnoten, zum Ende verwaschen die Aromen, erstaunlicherweise kommt dabei ein runder Gesamtton heraus. Dieser ist allerdings überaus mild und schwindet schnell. Ein etwas entäuschendes Bier. 13/10/9/10/12/9
Brown colour with a huge white head. Aroma is smoky and sweet. Taste is light malt sweetness with a good bit of smoke, bitter dry finish. Very Good balanced for a smoked beer.

Bottle. First beer Ive rated in bloody AGES! Gift from the agent. Pours hazy/murky brown, medium off-white head, lacing is spotty to poor. Nose is smoky, with distinct juniper notes, very yeasty, with further notes of apple, leather, wood, something almost citrusy here, perhaps something off the juniper Flavours are far more smoky than the nose would suggest, but not quite to the Smoked range, nice, balanced, and lightly spicy mouthfeel, pine/juniper driven throughout, with more of a peaty smoke character than a sausagey (German) smoke character. Fascinating stuff.

500ml bottle from Brewery Creek in Vancouver. Pours a deep red with a good tan head. Aroma is earthy and smoky with a mild funkiness and some smoked meat. There is some wood and fruitiness in there as well. Flavour is nicely bitter, smoky without being overpowering and just sweet enough but not cloying. Exceedingly balanced for a beer of this type. Finish has some sweet smoke and plenty of woodiness and a fair bit of earthiness in there as well. Delicious.

Hazy amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of smoky malt, caramel, dark fruit, & some spice; Flavor of roasted sweat malt, caramel, hops, and dark fruit; Smoky finish with slight alcohol; Fairly well balanced; Not bad overall.

500ml brown bottle. Batch 320 (if that means anything). Hazy dark orange colour, head is slightly tan and fades to a ring rather quickly. Nose has a soft smoky, bacony note and a bit of chocolate. Flavour is peaty, smoky, a little meaty, hint of cherry and some dry malt. Finish has some smoke hanging on, juniper berry, straw and ashy, peaty malts aftertaste. Medium body, well carbonated. Very enjoyable.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 I really liked this. Very smooth. Only a slight taste of juniper and the smoke was very mellow. Serving: Bottle

Bottle thanks to Owen. Cheers mate. Pours a dark brown with smallish beige coloured head. Inital aromas of smoke with a decent roasted malt back ground in support. Flavour shows plenty of smoke. Some raosted grain bitterness and a little frutiy sourness comes through as well. Medium mouthfeel. Nice beer.

bottle - Pours dark amber-brown and smells of smoke, wood, and roasted malt.  Theres substantial smoke in the flavor but it doesnt bury the malt sweetness, wood, and pine notes.  Theres also a bit of fruit and some herbal characteristics.  This brew is unique and very good.

Creamy large head misty red brown pour medium carbonation aromas smoked bright fruity touch juniper berries nice and bright  have a taste for them caramel floral  flavour up to the aroma caramel chocolate roasty tastes berry full on flavour of berries mild bitter good malt sweetness palate pleasant finish bitter sweet malt fruit smoked to perfection

Bottle 500ml batch#316. Pours clear copper with a dense beige head. Aroma is smokey, but not in an islay kind of way, some sweet berries are noticeable as well. Taste is medium sweet, light sour, very light bitter. Missing some bitterness in the finish. Medium body, oily texture, average to lively carbonation.

The wisp of wood fired malt drips delicately as this pours. The smoke is reasonably strong here, but the underlying fruity sweetness of the beer differentiates it from the Scherlenka beers. The berry inspired sweetness is a little cloy, but the solid tar smoke ash finish gives this a nice edge. Quite different, even for a smoked beer.

Tap at Paradiso Georgetown. Pours a deep, clear maroon with a tan, porter-like, creamy head. Leaves spotty lace. Really no retention here. Aroma is very nice: smoked bacon, barbecue, applewood, sweet pork. Here the smoked malt creates a subtler note than the Smoke without Fire, but it is still rich and beautiful. Taste adds lavender and soapy bitterness. Mouthfeel is dry and bitter with the palate finishing oily then cardboardy. Really lacking on the palate.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 Bottle. Recently bought, but apparently BBE is in April. When opened, the beer practically shoots out of the bottle. Pours a cloudy, reddish amber with a ridiculously large head that doesnt seem to be in a hurry anywhere. Aroma is sour berries - currants and gooseberry - some yeasty, sweet maltiness and juniper spiciness. After the strong aroma, the light taste is a bit of a surprise. Some yeasty maltiness, smoke, salty liquorice. Aftertaste is smokiness that gives away for the berries after a while. Palate is soft, but light.
A very good example of a smoked beer, smokey notes in the aroma and the taste without overdoing it, with an almost cough lolly taste as well. Drinkable liquid smoke.

Courtesy of Mane Liquor. Pours a red-brown with a large, billowing beige head. Aroma is mainly sweet malts and peat. Im getting the berries come through on the finish once the smoke gives way a little. This one gets much better as it warms up. Perfect amount of smokiness comes through. Lots of wood, pine and sweet, roast malts come through. Leaves that taste in your mouth of just finishing of a smooth cigar. Great beer

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 Reddish brown beer with orange edges. Smokey nose, a lovely little rounded vinegar, oak (barrel). Flavor is successful, surprisingly good balance between the semi-sweet and semi-bitter, between the smoked malt, juniper berries and hops. Long aftertaste.

Beer number 4000! Bottle. Batch 229. Hazy pale amber color, nice creamy beige head. Malty smoky aroma, juniper berries, woody notes, roasted, pine, black currant notes. Flavor from juniper berries, pine, woody, smoky notes, hops, some chocolate. Pine finish with juniper berries and some fruity notes.

Bottle. Red hazy with a thin white head. Aroma is dominated by the smoky junipers and malts. Taste is dry and sweet. Smoke is not so present in the mouth, but the juniper is really there and makes this beer what it is. Oily feel in mouth. Some bitterness from the hops in finish. Well done with an original beer
Excellent example on how to creat a good smoked beer. The smoke is complementary not overwhelming. The juniper berries are a little too subtle though. Very nice sipper.

A lightly hazed dark amber with a thin moka head. In aroma, a lightly smooked malt with faint herbal notes, fruity esters, and caramel. In mouth, an interesting smokey malt with light grainy malt, lactic points, nice hopping. On tap at Deep Ellum, Jan. 16 2011.

Pours a hazy copper that is well carbonated causing a tower of frothy dirty white head. Slabs of lace lie inconsistently along the glass. Pungent smoke enters the nose, with a woody, bacon character. However, the smoke is not overbearing, as it is well balanced with sweet malts and some dark fruits (brewed with juniper berries). Similar to the aroma, I get smokey, hickory notes in the taste. Norwegian Wood isnt as meaty as some smoked beers, but displays enough that it cant be mistaken. What I find most interesting is the interplay between the woody smoke flavors and the sweet malts that balance it out. The finish displays a solid dry herbal hoppiness that levels out the smoke. I really only find juniper berries in the nose, as it is hard to decipher any in the layers of flavor. The body is smooth, somewhat creamy, but really easy to drink for a smoked beer. For a lot of beers of this style, its one and done. Norwegian Wood is a beer I can see myself drinking two or three in a sitting. I have to hand it to HaandBryggeriet for making one of the most drinkable smoked beers I have had to date.

Appearance: earthen woody browns with a light haze. Tannish head fades into a thin tan head. Swirls with nice puff and then fades back into initial thin layer.

Nose: smoke with a touch of sweet, wood, earth, and dirt. Wet earth, wet wood, and wet firewood; being deep in the middle of a forest after rain has put out a still smoldering fire. Old worn leather. Fireside smoke, burning embers.

Palate: chocolate and smoke, woody and smoke. Apple skins with a faint tinge of plum for fruity tannic tartness along the edges. Earth and wood damp and smoldering. Cedar. Bacon smoke is barely a whisper, more of a clean smoke. Red hot embers. Smoke lingers gently in breath with the essence of windblown embers and forestry.

Final Thoughts: intriguingly different than what I was expecting, and all in good ways. Definitely not a Bamberg rauche. Unique different and uniquely tasteful, she is yet another fantastic beer from Haandbryggeriet.
Draught from gingernanhattan. A reDdish brown. Not as oaky as I would have thought. A bit sour I guess it was the juniper.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a medium tan head. Aroma and flavour of hops, smoke, fruit and spice.
Pours hazy brown with a medium head. Aroma is mostly fruits and hops. Flavor is very complex with malts, hops, fruits and many other things I cant recognise. Light but still so rich. Very nice.

2007 bottle.   pours a hazed copper.  small bubble dirty white head.  aroma of doughy smoked salmon, and milk chocolate malt balls with a touch of sherry.   doughy tannic wood with a faded campfire smoke.   spice and juniper berries faded.   probably past its prime.  never had a fresh bottle.   transformed into a doughy campfire sherry oxidation concoction.  not bad though.    put some in the chili i was cooking FYI

Dark murky brown; medium tan head. Really pungent aroma - smoke, wood, and.. chocolate? Hmm..  Really original flavor. Really woody beer with a big dose of smoke. Maybe its the juniper berries that gives it that something extra. Some nail polish / paint thinner, is the only downside.
21st January 2008  Amber beer. Initial intense fruity burst (presumably juniper) is quickly subdued by dry smokyness. Okay but a bit heavy on the smoke.

Tasted 2011-01-04. Pours unclear, amber with a white head with a yellow teint. Aroma is smoked bacon, grass, piney hops, cocoa. Taste is very well balanced between smoky, sweet maltiness and a somewhat bitter juniperberry-ish finish.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2011 1 pint .9 fl oz bottle. This a very simple beer, but pleasant none the less. Some thick, cloud-like froth head, decent retention, an oily, partially translucent body, and fig brown color. The aroma really only consists of a subtle, yet interesting mix of lightly sour/tart berry and melon fruit with smoked woody grain malt.  In all an actuality, the flavor can be described in a similar fashion. There a nice strong bitterness for a relatively lower abv. It medium bodied, lightly tart, and prominently bitter through the finish. Flavor notes really stay consistent through out. Again, melons, lightly tart berries, smoked woody grains, and light caramel malt. Overall, this was definitely different than anything Ive tried before. The subtleties, uniqueness, and simplicity of this beer make this a very quality brew.

0.5l bottle. Pours a nice dark bronze body with a thin, lacing - almost yellow&green head! Aromas of woody smokiness, berries and sweet malts. Medium bodied and lively carbonation. Lots of smoke, some leather, fruity and you can really taste the fantastic juniper berries. A really good brew!

Cloudy brown pour with slight off white head.  The aroma of smoke and light fruit.  Flavor is smokey, delicious, nice saltiness.  Cure meat.  Bacon.  Mild sweetness too.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.   This beer is like standing in the middle of forest after a forest fire and taking a deep breath.
Sample from BBF 2010. Nice slightly smoked flavor - at first you have to look for it, but it makes itself known on the backside of the sip. Nice ale!
Really strong, "forest-like" smoky nose. Thin foam-like head. Strong but not too heavy taste with cloudy yeast, juniper, malt and smoke. This is really special beer, and very good one indeed!

Nose is smokey campfire with notes of berries, fruity notes, and dusty yeast. Pours hazy unfiltered amberish brown, with a big foamy head and soft lace. The flavor is smokey campfire with more fruity juniper berry notes, touches of caramel, and dusty yeast. Well carbonated, lingering yeast notes. Interesting.

Bottle. Pours clear reddish brown with a bubbly off white head. Quite yeasty and fruity aroma with notes of berries, caramel and light bonfire smoke. The flavour is smoke from burning wood, berries, fruit, caramel and bittering hops. Light smoked finish.

bottle from Bierkompass. Hazy brown colour, large and very persistant off-white head. Aroma of wood, juniper and dark malts. Full-bodied, roasetd malt, caramel, espresso coffee, lots of wood and rather shy hints of smoke and juniper. The juniper goes very well with the woody flavours. A very interesting and tasty beer.

bottled poured into a pint glass.  This beer smells amazing....notes of malt and gin.  The color is a brownish hazy red color that is gorgeous.  The taste is very malty, similar to the Dark Force from this brewer, but with the juniper berry notes coming though. Not to heavy, but lots of smoke coming through.  Not an everyday beer, but a real treat for sure.

50cl traded bottle (Batch 109 from Nov 2007). Pours a deep, dark bronze color with a big khaki head. No real lacing. Aroma is chocolate, smoke and gin from the berries. Peaty flavor that has some chocolate malt and ends a touch sweet. Finish is slight bitterness from cold coffee. Surprisingly light and easy to drink.

On tap, CAH. Aroma is meaty, smoky, earthy mushrooms, hint of papaya fruit. Intriguing. Body is mellowed flavors, still very earthy with smoky notes pervading. Palate is quite light, surprisingly, lending drinkability. Perhaps best paired with a charred gamey meat with simmered mushroom sauce.
A fun beer to drink as it almost taste a bit like wood! This scores high because of its originality and it makes me want to try it again, maybe with a smoked whiskey on the side..

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted smokey caramel aroma. Roasted malty smokey woody bitter caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty woody smokey finish.

50 cl bottle, batch 264. Brown color with nice off-white head.
Aroma is smoke and dark fruit. Taste of smoke dark fruit and caramel.
Lovely beer.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malts and smoke. Flavour is smokey roasted malts, coffee and caramel. Palate is roasted malts.

1 Pint .9 oz. bottle (batch 209- brewed feb. 09- wow!)  from Oak Tree Discount Wines and Liquors (NJ), served in shaker-I cant help but think Im having this long wanted beer under the same circumstances like a month and 2 years ago when I had Speedway Stout... odd.  poured a non transparent murky and foreboding darkened brown with shades of black and maroon, one finger creamy off tan head sat around like myself (bad company), low carbonation.  Aroma of juniper was apparent as soon as I cracked open the bottle, closer inspection yields some fine hardwood smoke, malt, and better times.  Hits the mouth with a wide and enduring body, malt definately has a ton of smoke which is more than welcome by me, some caramel/molasses with dried grass and junipers, finish is lingering and makes me smile like I havent in a long time.  I can see what all the hype is about, the beer is damn near gone and I want MORE!  Perhaps I should leave now...

Sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2010. Pours a hazy brown beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, wood and smoke. The flavor follows the nose closely. The palate is sweet. Overall an average beer.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2011 Smoky hop aroma, a bit metallic. Flavor is sour and smoky but it also has a fresh grassy hop aroma and vague hints of juniper berries. I like this one, it clearly has a special taste!
