50 cl bottle. Pours dark red brown coloured and cloudy with a beige head that disappears quite fast. Aroma is smoked, raisins and burnt caramel. A very tasteful smoked flavour with malts and dark chocolate. A smooth and coffee like smoke finish, but not as much smoked as Schlenkerla Märzen.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is breaddy malt and light smoke. Flavour is malt, smoke, fruit. flower and alcohol.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 8 Oct 2010) Reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, smoky nose with notes of juniper berries, burning twigs and dried fruit. Malty, roasted taste with smoke, juniper berries, chocolate, dried (or even) smoked fruit and apriocts. More than medium body, with balanced sweetness. Some bitterness coming through in the finish, but mainly overshadowed by smoke and juniper. Interesting and quite nice.

Hazy yellowish brown with med head. Odd aroma. Combination of spruce, juniper, smokey sweet malt and touch of sweetness. Flavor is smokey juniper malt with a bit of caramel sweetness. Coffee is hanging around there too with a hint of dried fruit every once in a while. The finish fluxes between smoke and bright caramel/fruit.  Carbonated, light and creamy mouth feel.
Peaty, smoky nose, wonderful aroma. Rugged, woodsy feel.  Not overly bitter, slighlyly sour aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours reddish brown with tan head. Nose and taste of smoked wood and berry. Very light mouth feel.

From Kihoskh, Copenhagen, DK.
Bottled, 081010.
Brown with off-white head. Aroma of smoke and roasted malt. Flavor with spices (junipers?) and malt.

clear amber smooth offwhite head.
slightly smoked aroma, sweet malts, faint berries, overall profile is clearly berries and smoke accented.
flavor is pretty bitter, smoked, bitter berries, very high sort of woody or fruit peely bitterness, malts in the background. Doesnt really work for me, too bitter in a weird way. will probably get better as you get used to it
Bottle @ 2nd BBF. Hazy dark orange - light red colour, off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, smoke. Flavour is coffee, roasted malts, sour fruits. Medium carbonation, smoky finish.

@BBF10:
Off white foamy head.
Amber brown color.
Smell is a fine mix of wood, meat, malts and smoke.
Taste is a good mix of smoke, meat, smoked malts, hint of hops and spices. Grassy aftertaste.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Pours a high foamy head on top of a gloudy red/brown colour.

Nice malted aromas, coffee and juniper on the nose.

Rich in flavours, got alot of aromas going for it. As I said, juinper and coffee is present, also some chocolate, licorice and even some burnt coffee beans on the back end (you know, more raw than coffee). Bitternes very aggresive in the beging, but is smoothening out after the inital start. Complex

This is a really interesting beer, with a modest nose and a powerful taste. Adding the wild growing herbs to the mix absolutely adds a sting to the whole mix. Norwegian Wood never tasted as good as this.

Bottle. Pours nrealy clear deep reddish amber with a tan head. Taste is highly bitter, medium sweet and lightly sour/acidic. Palate has a medium body, soft to average carbonation, sticky, slightly oily texture. Aroma has malts, smoke, wood, pine resins, and floral notes.
Bottle at Boreft Bier Festival 2010, Bodegraven. Dark red brew with an farmlike start, this will fade away. Than its gets an smokey sour/sweet fruity taste.
Smells like coffee with milk. Sweet juniper taste. Secondary taste is grassy, which brought into my mind AIV fodder.
Tasted at the Borefts Bierfestival 2010. Pours dark filthy red, smells incredible, like smoked ham roasted on an open fire. after a while it simply gets very drinkable and smooth.
Dark cloudy reddish brown in colour. Then to no head. Massive wood oak smoke smell. Wood smoke and yeast and earth tatse. Best smoke beer Ive had.

Pours a nice deep red with a good head and good lace. The aroma is earthy and smoky with a mild funkiness and some smoked meat. There is some wood and fruitiness and a mild sweet aroma in there as well. The flavor follows but its nicely bitter compared to other smoky beers Ive had. There is some sweet smoke and plenty of woodiness and a fair bit of earthiness in there as well. Delicious.

Bottled on 6/26/09. Thanks to CanIHave4Beers. Nice amber-ruby color. Awesome smoked character. Nice firm bitterness, which compliments the smoke well. Very smooth palate. Some weird fruitiness lurking in the background but it is well enough covered up by the smoke that its easily ignorable unless you seek it out.

Tap at Blind tiger for Haandbryggeriet event - nice, caramel toffee and wonderfully woody. nice balance of smoke and sour. touch of berry tart in the finish. smoke is a bit subdued especially as it warms up. really well balanced and tasty.

500 ml bottle. Rated @ 20.6.2009.
Pours a dark hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Loads of fruits, spices and juniper on the nose. The flavour is somewhat weak with fruits, smoke and malts. Medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation. Refreshing.

Pouring this in my pint creates a smoky smoke cloud around the room. I am having a hard time seeing through the thick smoke so I am finding it hard to describe the appearance of this beer. Smoky and a bit yeasty (?) is the taste.

500ml bottle from Julios I think...
Appearance : Slight gusher. Deep amber with a medium fizzy head that is short lived. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Light smoke with some red fruits. Some smoked bacon with a hint of liquorice maybe..Light raisins. Lots of butterscotch.

Taste : Carbonation rather aggressive at first.  Woody and smokey. Some light caramel. Finish smokey and very dry. Finish has light notes of liquorice and raisins. Lots of butterscotch.

Overall : Interesting smoke. Carbonation is a bit too intense. I dont like the strong butterscotch. Nice woodiness. Interesting beer but Im just not able to appreciate this.

Caramel color with an off white head. Smells like a smokey campfire. Molasses and brown sugar on nose. Good with spicy chili because of the slight sweet and caramel flavor. Smokey flavor without being heavy on the body. Smooth drinking beer with mild carbonation. Perfect in fall.

Had this while camping at BCTC this year.  Pours a light clear orange with a thin beige head.  Faint smoke, toast and malt.  Toasty with light grain.  Light lingering smoke.  Wanted a little more of the juniper, but still a nice enough beer.
darkish and astringent with an overwhelming flavor of band aid plastic....in some really nice oak aged wood.

Bottle, batch 232, brewed 6/26/09. Dark orange hue, thin white head. Nose is big smokey wood with a backbone of rich malt and faint fruity esters. Flavor is light smoked beechwood with hints of vanilla, light fruit and berries, and bready malts, finishes slightly sweet. Medium body, slick texture, light carbonation. A smooth, smokey, light sweet beer, very easy-drinking and flavorful!

Tap at Rattle n Hum. Amber-ruby-brown pour with a soft, white head. Smoke and fruit interlace in the aroma. Flavor is lightly sweet with more smoke and fruits. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Finishes sweet with lingering juniper notes. Very good beer.

Charcoal and smoked meat is the most prominent flavors in this one, but they are letting other flavors through too. There is a slight spiciness from the juniper that plays well with the smoked flavors. One of the better smoked beers Ive had, but I still thought that even half a bottle was a bit much to drink on its own.

Bottle (batch 232 with a best before of 26.06.2011). Could have sworn that I had rated this before. Pours with a small off-white head over a hazy amber-orange body. Aroma of smoke, bacon, campfire, burning wood, with some fruitiness, juniper and maple syrup hiding behind the smoke. Taste is smoke, a bit harshly so, bitter, burnt, a bit of molasses and bread. Long, lingering smokey finish. Not really my thing. Lively bubbles, creamy body.
Hazy amber with light brown head - nice malty aroma with hints of smoke - good malty body with hints of smoke and with a long light smoke aftertaste - very tasty

On tap during Haandbryggeriet presentation at Cardinal. Creamy tanned head on top of a cloudy deep orange body. Good lacing. Aroma has oak, smoke, caramel and dark dried fruits in it. Taste is fruity, smokey, sweet, bitter and light acidic. Medium to full body. Nice long piney, smokey finish.
Draft. Brown pour with tan head. Smoke, peat, bacon like aroma with some light berry . Flavor is smoked, nice flavor with woody and a light berry note. Smoke beer done right.

16.9 oz bottle into Sam Adams glass. Aroma is burnt wood, bacon, malt. Smokin good! Sorry. Pours copper with a nice thick rocky head that slowly dissipates, leaving a centimeter-thick layer of foam and creamy lace. Taste is sweet smoked malt with no bitterness. I taste no juniper berries. Carbonation is medium to high, body is full--well almost. What a fantastic beer.

Pours murky dark brown, thick creamy light tan head. Aroma of light smoke, ripe fruit, some spiciness. Taste has some citrus with lots of toasted malt and a light amount of smoke. Kind of sweet overall with not as much smoke as expected. Medium thick body, soft carbonation.
50cl, Norwegian brewery, smoked brew with juniper berries, from Den Bierzolder Heule, complex brew, not balanced, hazy, good head, nice brew

2007 bottle.  poured deep coper without much head. spicy aroma ith nice amount of smoke. balenced sweetness witha very nice smoke profile. the juniper adds an interesting spice, lingering smooth finsih. one of the best smooked beers ive had

Hazed orange brown pour with a thick beige head.  Mainly a smokey aroma, little toffeeish, nutty, and roasty.  Meaty smokiness is prominent in the flavor but doesnt overpower, juniper flavors are detectable but quite subdued.  More toast and nuts.  Medium, creamy body.  Pretty nicely put together, but I wouldnt want to buy it again.  There are several readily available smoked beers that are as good or better for much less money.

Deep murky brown with a three finger tan head.  Dark complex fruit wafts up during the pour.  Chocolate is noted upon closer examination along with smoke and funk.  In the flavor smoke permeates everything.  Rich chocolate and, again, complex fruit.  Alcohol warming just under the surface.  Some well marinated grilled meat.  A zesty feel puts pinpricks on the tongue.  The smoke was a bit overdone but this was a very nice beer.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2010 Pours a deep copper body with a thick, yet quickly disappearing off-white head. Smell is smoked wood, spruce and juniper. Interesting. Taste is dark malts at first, then gradually changing to a very smoked spruce-like character. Bitter notes of hay and floral hops. Long-lasting bitter smokey aftertaste with hints of coffee, resin and wood. Definitely living up to its name, Norwegian Wood is one of the most characteristic beers from Haandbryggeriet; theres a lot of the promised Norwegian Wood in here. Solid craft brew, despite its relatively low drinkability due to the very poignant flavors. Moreover, this is really a rather unique brew in the sense that its a smoked, traditional ale thats hard to categorize. Nevertheless, this beer echoes with the uncut diamonds of historical brewery traditions. Nice stuff.

Thanks to piginapen for sending me this bottle. 

The beer pours a hazy dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma is meaty smoke with some charred wood, ash and burnt malt. The flavor is smoke, roasted malt, chocolate, juniper and dark fruit. The aftertaste is extremely smoky. Thin-medium and slightly watery mouthfeel. Low-medium carbonation.
toast, roasty, smoke, woody, brown, black, cloudy, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Pours cola brown color with tan head. Smoked meat aroma. Roasted and smoked malt flavors with a hint of coffee. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Very interesting. A big smoky malt aroma from a dark amber with a big head. The flavor is big with roasted malt but not sweet at all. Smoky wood with a hint of bourbon maybe. Very warming on the throat. Finish is dry with a long lasting after taste.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 Bottle at Pingvinen, Bergen. Dark brown color with light brown head. Light smokey apricot aroma. Taste sweet caramel again with apricot touch. Good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2010 Bottle from Vinmonopolet, batch 243. Pours a delightfully amber, clear brew, with a perfect thick offwhite head. Smells like an early summer morning on the countryside, fruity and sweet! The aroma is equal, but dominated by smoke and burned wood, as one would expect. Spectacular! Oh man, this is great! Ill let it chill a little bit more. But I love this beers great balance between smoky roast and light cheerful fruityness!! Lovely grassy hops, yet with that lovely smoky roundness - my favorite Haandbryggeriet beer so far (except the previous batch of Hesjeøl)! I really love light, hoppy beers, and this one is great, I only should have chilled it some more before drinking it. But Ill buy a lot more of this! The experts say its good to store as well, so Ill be buying a lot of this to store and enjoy later on!

Update 2010-05-24: this bottle has only been resting for a month longer than the previous, but I couldnt wait! Its mostly like before, but I notice a wonderful smoky, lingering aftertaste, like slightly burned newly-baked bread - just great if you ask me! My previous rating stands; this is one of my favorite beers!
Dark, ruddy reddish brown body. Aroma of smoke, roasted malt and resinous. Flavor of smoke, toast, roasted malt. Chocolate and nuts over this. Thin.

Draft at Maxs, Fells point: Poured a medium amber with a small white head, nice smoky nose, flavor is of smoked malts, some spice, with a very light finish. Good, but could have a bit more intense malts for me. For some reason, I felt like singing the Beatles while drinking this one.

Comes out of the tap a barely transparent mahogany-honey brown with a cream-white, fine-bubbled head. Rich, malty, smoked-wood aroma has an undertone of barbecue. Smoky, barbecue-like flavor is malty wit hints of spice, caramel and even sweetness. Tingly, lively texture rounds out a very tasty and distinctive beer.

Wow, this is one interesting beer. Ive never been a big smoked beer fan, but this is very subtle and I really enjoyed both the uniquness and complexity of it. The smoke flavour is very well balanced with the malt and the spice is subtle but adds to the overall complexity of the beer.
Hazy copper colour. Head is creamy and off-white. Aroma has leather, smoke,tar, nuts and wood. Flavor is malty, smoky, spicy and has liquorice. Moderate biternes and a round mouthfeel.

Batch 209:

OK, really nice tan head, and very active carbonation. Not much aroma but a little dirty/basement. Orange brown in color and fairly clear. Sweet & sour, wood & mold. A sort of slightly astringent flavor in there too. Mouthfeel is light to medium, fizzy, and fairly long and smooth. Overall, not my favorite "wood" but definitely interesting enough to have a discussion about it. I get a bit of Belgian in this beer, and of course, strong smokey flavor on the first taste. That seems to have mellowed as I get through the first glass, but still very present. However, the bottle says its brewed with Juniper Berries, and I cant taste that at all. Very strange. I had expected more of a forest flavor. Sampled at room temperature (65°F) from the 500ml bottle.

500 ml bottle. Amber to red body with 
off white head. Smoke and berries with caramel
and some spices in aroma. Bitterness is ok, 
flavour is dominated with the smokiness and
berries. I enjoy this one quite a lot.

Pours reddish copper with a small off-white head. Nose is peat smoke, piney, slightly citrus, notes of leaves. In the mouth peppery, dry, some smoke. Light body, dry finnish. Good stuff, could use a little x-tra kick.
Poured hazy dark amber, slightly peety smoke, caramel, little bacon, little wood, slight spice, slight apple.
Bottle. Rich toffee colored beer with a cream colored head. Toffee aroma. Toffee and light smoke flavor with earth and spice. Medium bodied. Toffee and light smoke lingers with some earthiness.

Bottle. Murky, dark, soupy red-brown body, medium dissipating buff head. Smoky, woody nose, rich and meaty. Same smoke dominance in the body, woody, with light tartness, leather, and toasted malts. Rich and interesting.

Bottle, thanks Vaiz! Hazy hazel pour with bubbly head, lightly tanned.
Aroma of smokish hops and burned oak.
Very smokey flavour, almost like sucking on smoked wood flakes.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a thin creamy off-white head and lots of lacing. Very smoky aroma with spices and juniper berries. Smoky flavor with spices and a creamy texture. Bitter finish. Nice and special brew.

Dark amber colored brew. The aroma is nice, mildly smoked, wood and juniper berries. The flavor is a balanced mix of smoke, juniper and some woody tones. The juniper kicks in more after a while with a stronger juniper berry aftertaste. Maybe gets a bit too thin and fruity at the end, could use some more smoky malts perhaps. Still very enjoyable.

Bottle at Eulogy in Philadelphia. Hands down my new favorite smoked beer. This being said, this isnt too smokey but what I really enjoyed is the fact that you can still make out some more subtle flavors, like the piney/berry like flavors of the juniper and some caramel like malts. First sip is the most interesting because the other flavors shine well and are then backed up by the smoke. Im really glad I tried this.

Mahogany brown, almost red colour; aroma of smoke and juniper berries, tangy more than sweet; mouthfeel is tangy as well, you can feel the juniper berries tickling your tongue; flavor is smokey, full of tangy juniper berries with mild to medium bitterness. Interesting, but not that complex - or even pleasant beer, to be honest.

A good offering, but not quite as flavorful as I expected. The smokiness is great, the juniper berries are nice... the problem is there just isnt enough of it! I guess I was expecting something more like a rauchbier or a strong, American-style smoked porter. Recommended for people who want just a hint of smoke in their brew.

500 mL bottle.  (bb April 2010).  Aroma is dominated by smoke (in a good way), and there is some berry sweetness in there as well.  (I dont know from juniper).  Flavour is more balanced, with the smoke early, and the berries right at the end.  A little chocolate too.  Carbonation is maybe a touch heavier than it needs to be.  Some graininess in the mouthfeel.  Pretty good!
well-rounded and malty with a nice peet-smokiness and a hint of juniper. not as complex as i had hoped.  texture is fine but nothing special.

Tastes like bacon! very heady and it has a bit of a hickory smoked flavor 
followed by some bacon on the palate.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep copper with a small, tan head.
Peaty in both aroma and flavour with a nice smokiness.
Slightly sourish with some toffee in the background.
Low to medium bitterness.

50cl Bottle from De Molen. Unclear brown colour with hints of red, small off white head. Aroma of light smoked wood, light spices and caramel. Flavour is sweet, light spicy, soft caramel, some dark fruits, nice smoky touch, juniper berries come out in the finish (jenever-like) along with a good hoppy and roasty bitterness. Medium bodied. Loads of flavours, and all blend in very nicely. This works out just nice for me, really good stuff.

Bottle. Brown colour with a nice off-white head. Smoke, juniper berries, toasted malt, caramel, licorice, beef jerky, wood, lightly acidic, a bit of fruitiness, light spiciness. A nicely balanced and quite complex smoky beer,

Denne må def. drikkes ved rett temp. Røkduften blir mer fremtredende og den smaker mer røk enn den lukter.

Ganske smidig øl med lang ettersmak. Ikke så mye "bacon" som f.eks. Nils Oscars rökporter, men så er jo dette en ale også. Litt overrasket er vi begge. Dette skal være bryggeriets standardøl... Sånn passe hyggelig.
Bottle. Hazy copper, medium head. Hoppy aroma, slightly smoked. Medium palate. Salty, smoked, spicy taste. Juniper berries are there, but not very prominent. Low in carbonation. Nice, bitter finish.

Bottle, 2009-12-05, Göteborg
AR: Smoked whitefish 
AP: Peachice tee colored body, apricot 2 inch steady head
F: First smoke, then plum, then again smokey finishinh
It is little bit like driku from Gotland!

500ml Bottle - Hazy amber/copper, with a foamy head. Smoky and fruity aroma with ash, bacon, caramel and dried fruit.  The taste is smoky with roasted malt, bacon,  fruit, caramel and some faint hoppy elements. Rich and enjoyable, but I dont think I could drink too much of this.

16.9oz bottle

Apperance - Hazy mahogany in color, this beer poured an ambitious beige head that takes a bit to settle.  

Aroma - Dominated by smoke and meat smells.  With a little bit of pine beneatht it.

Taste - Strong smoke taste up front.  Jerky, as well.  Juniper is very faint.

Mouthfeel - Medium  mouthfeel, with a nice hoppy finish to balance out the smoke.

1 PINT 9 FL OZ- Pours dark red to almost black with a nice thick bubbly head similar to a Belgian beer, aroma is fruity and floral. The taste is not what I expected, it has a very smoky taste to it, very interesting. I have to say this beer is one of the most creative beers ive ever had.

Bottle, 50cl - Clear firey red beer with a large beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of smoked salami, wood and roasted malts. Flavor is malty with strong notes of smoke, puffed rice, sour wood and coffee.
Murky amber, offwhite head. Roasted malt in aroma. Starts sweet but turns quickly into smoky roastiness. Hints of pine. Finishes with well balanced slight bitterness.
Bottled:Pours hazy brown with a dense head. Campfire smoke and juniper on the nose. Flavour is dry and smoked with juniper and some sour notes in the background. Very balanced and thirst quenching.

(Bottle) Pours hazy dark amber to copper red with some brown hints.  Small, creamy sand coloured head. The aroma holds clean smoke up front, more campfire and salty smoked meat than burned manure. The undertones are more complex than your regular smoked beer with notes of spicy pine, juniper berries, rosemary, blue plums and toasted/nutty/light caramelly malt alongside hints of herbal, floral and earthy hops. Light fruity, maybe even some phenols. A touch of bananas from the sweet malt and the light ester notes.  Some clean yeast hints. Wow, this is a fantastic nose, the almost minty spiciness plays well with the smoke. The flavour is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Tones of smoke, juniper berries, herbs, wood, earth, caramel, nuts, alongside a whisper of spices like ginger and cardamom. Good malt profile. The mouthfeel is clean, round and light soft with a light to medium carbonation. Finish is earthy, wooden, smokey and nutty.  Medium bodied. A fantastic beer from a brewery that is about to steal the Norwegian (beer) gold medal from Nogne O.
Bottle. Tastes like a drinkable mix of sahti and stout... juniper tartness, chocolate, smokeiness,

Bottle. Reddish colour with a medium, off-white head. Aroma is of smoke with a hint of juniper. A nice smokiness like that of a camp fire. Flavour is complex and slightly acidic, a bit fruity and a bit bitter with notes of smoke and juniper. Quite a lot of juniper berries in the aftertaste. Nice beer.

Bottle. 

A deep ruby brown color with a medium-sized tanned head that leaves some lacings.

The smell is quite pleasant with gentle smoky aromas, caramel malts, juniper, tart fruits and wood. 

The taste is somewhat sweet with a complementary tart fruity flavor. Kind of dense malty backbone and notes of caramel. Restrained, yet prominent smoky aromas. The juniper adds a nice fresh character to the beer. Hints of wood. The finish as a gentle bitterness to it and lingering malty flavors. 

Medium body, slightly sticky texture with a nice dry finish. 

I enjoyed this one, lovely balance between the smoke and tart fruity aromas. Easy to drink.   

Bottle.

Bottled home. Ive been lokking for this beer for ages, from  the descriptions alone i just knew i would like this beer. And  i did. Mahogeny colored, firm head, very nice. Smoky nose with juniper, some oak. Very pleasant smoky flavor, some bitterness but very easy going, making it easy to drink. Very nice brew, for me one of the best of this brewery.

Bottle from systembolaget, Sweden. Light brown fluffy head that lingers a long time. Red-orange color. Realy nice smoke arom. Sweet taste with a rough bitterness that lasts a long time and makes this hard to consume in any larger quantities. Medium body.

Ruby brown, very large tan head, excellent lacing.
Aroma is quite smoky, some fruit, musty.
Flavour is not as smoky as the aroma, more fruit, some yeast, creamy.
Lightly bitter mouthfeel, medium/large body, high carbonation.
Finished long, smoky. 
Quite nice, excellent aroma, sweetness comes through at times. 
500ml bottle purchased from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York.
Opened on January 18, 2009.
Batch 72, BB April 2010.

Bottle.
Pours mahogny with a yellowish head.

Belgian aroma of spices and banana.

Dark fruits, pine, spices and light smokey taste.

Bottle shared with Michael, Michael  and Darrell at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Chestnut colored without much head or lacing.  Aroma reminiscent of the leather straps that old fashioned barber chairs used to have. Taste has some dark fruit and cherries, progressing to beef jerky then finishing with barbecued bacon.  Nicely complex.

Bottle. Batch No. 72, Brewed Apr. 07, Best before Apr. 2010. Large fizzy tan head that mostly diminished, spotty amounts of lacing, fast rising carbonation, and an orange brown body. The aroma is sweet, malty, mildly smoky, and fruity. The flavor is sweet smoky, malty, fruity, lightly bitter, and a semi-dry finish. The mouthfeel was smooth and this is a medium bodied beer. Overall, there is a distinct smoky aroma and flavor, but not overpowering. I do not ordinarily enjoy a smoky tasting beer, but this beer is worthy of a try.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2009 It poured a hazy dark golden liquid with a medium sized dirty white foam. Smell of smoke, wood and nuts. Almost like your clothes smell after sitting next to an open fire. Fairly smooth with just a bit of stingy carbonation. Thick body and not very watery, allot of taste without being to much. It tasted of smoke, wood, bacon and something burned. Same with the smell it tasted like a campfire. Im not a huge fan of smoked beers but this was pretty nice.

Bottled. Dark amber to brown, beige dishwashing head. Nose has smokiness, juniper-wood, earth, ash and yeastiness, hints of licorice. Flavor is pretty much the same, quite a lot of juniper berries, woodiness, little caramel malts, ashy yeastiness. A lot in common with Dark Force, same in-house homebrew feeling. Standard Haandbryggeriet palate: slightly thin and heavily overcarbonated. Mouthfeel certainly doesnt fit in with the flavors. Works best after sitting in the glass for an hour.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Oslo.

The beer is copper-colored with a large head. The aroma contains smoke but not as much as I had expected. A little bacon and citrus were there too.

The taste was not as I thought, rather pale smoky. Fairly sweet, with clear elements of fruit and berries. I did also feel a certain taste of soap or anyway something chemically. The ending was quite dry with a very mild bitterness. The body was rather thin.
bottle, walnut color with thick tan foam, aroma of plastic, wood chips, vegetal, flavor really picks up with lots of smoked beef, italian herbs, great lasting finish
50cl bottle, Alko. Pours a dark brown color. Aroma is chocolate and fruity. Bamberg smoke and some berry flavour. I really liked this one.

THOUGHTS: This was great. It really seemed like an ancient drink.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a dark, clear brownish red that looked like cola with great carbonation and an average, light khaki head that mostly diminished and left fair lacing. The aroma was slight milk chocolate, slight BBQ sauce, smoke, fruitiness and berries. The initial flavor was sweet and slightly sour; while the finish was sweet, rather sour and slightly bitter. There was smoke, caramel, berry, smoke bitterness and slight chocolate. The medium body was fairly dry with fizzy carbonation and a smokey and lightly astringent finish.

Bottle from Hops City. Pours dark brown with a tall head. The aroma is sharp with a lactic sourness apparent. Meat and grains are noted. I was a little afraid of infection, but the flavor is clean with no apparent sourness. It is milky, smooth, and meaty with mild campfire and not a whole lot of juniper bite. This needs more smoke.

Bottle.  Pours a browish color with a nice sized head.  Aroma is strong with smoked malts.  Notes of dark fruits and some sweet malts stand out as well.  The feel on the palate is carbonated and thick.  The flavor pulls out some more sweet malts and it finishes a bit dry, leaving a nice smoked aftertaste.  I am normally not a fan of smoked beers, but this one was very good.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a extremely large sized head of foamy finely sized tan colored bubbles that were and left behind a slightly hazy softly carbonated brown colored body. The mild aroma was malty smoky spicy and mild vinous. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. The good flavor contained notes of malt hops and spices.
Bottle from Bergen vino. Clear brown with a big head. Smells of smoke and spice. Flavor is muted malts, peat and lots of oak texture.

bottle @ biergasthof Schiffner. Hazy dark red amber in colour with with a creamy off-white head. Smooth smokey wood nose, distict but very gentle bamberger smoke malt. gentle enough for me to actually like it. Flavour are spicey with a lot of underlying fruit, probably the juniper. very enjoyable, well bal;anced beer.

An interesting mix of smoke and juniper.  Norwegian Wood pours a reddish mahogany color with an excellent head.  The aroma is strongly smoky with a light alcohol note.  The juniper doesnt really come through until you get to the flavor.  Altogether, its an interesting mix of spruce, smokehouse meats, sweet malt and spice.  As it warms up, theres a light phenolic note.  The smoke doesnt dominate the flavor profile as it does in the aroma.  It sits well on the palate, fairly light carbonation, smooth feel.  Im not sure how much smoked beer I can ever stomach in one sitting, but its certainly enjoyable by the half liter.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy amber color, full frothy off-white head. Hoppy aroma with smoky notes. Smoky flavor with a touch of licorice and coffee. Full body, medium carbonation. Its no Schlenkerla, but far from awful.

Bottle. Pours brown with a large head. The aroma and flavor of smoke are dominant, but they seem to have found a happy medium. I didnt find the smoke to be too overwhelming even though I prefer a lighter smoke profile. Easy on the palate overall. I enjoyed it, but I should have saved it for a barbecue.

From a bottle at Eulogy in Philadelphia. Very smokey flavor and aroma. Pours a translucent brown with very little, off brown head. Heavy smokey or woody flavor with very little other flavorings. A quick and easy palate that doesnt linger. Tastes like drinking a tree

I decided to give this one a shot to celebrate my new job.  Up to this point I had yet to have a bad Norwegian beer.  Poured a dark, cloudy brown with a nice, frothy tan head.  Very odd smell to it and the taste was a little too smokey for my taste.  I wont say this beer sucked ass but it was nowhere near the quality of the Nogne brews.  I cant believe I wasted $9 on a bottle of this.
Bottle. Dark brown with beige head. Smoke and slightly sour, not really a favorite of mine.
A bottle 0.5l Batch 220 from Alko. Malty nose. Quite foaming. Pale head. Hazy pale brown coppery colour. Slightly sour malty taste with some hints of Juniper. Some smokiness and bitterness.

Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. The aroma is smoke, ash and berries. The aroma carries over to the flavour and the smoked malt and spicy juniper balances out nicely. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel and theres subtle bitterness from the juniper. More smoke in the finish...a delicious traditional brew. (Bottle - big thanks to Dave!)
Bottle- Poured a copper brown with a thin foam off-white head.  Smoked malts and wood.  A slight sweet berry dryness blends with this smokey malt treat.  Smoke em if you got em!

Pours brown with reddish edges and a thin white head. The aroma is smoky and a bit sweet. Flavor is light malt sweetness with a good bit of smoke, bitter dry finish.  Very good if you like smoked beers.

Pours brown with a copper tint.Small head.Very noticeable smoke in the aroma hides the sweetness well.Tastes sweet smoked malt and juniper spicy. some bitterness .Finishes dry with lingering smoke.A really enjoyable beer.Very nice balanced smoke flavor.

Bottle from Briskeby Vinmonopolet, Oslo, batch 215, brewed 10/03/09, Norwegian Wood on the ipod in the background... murky orange brown with a persistent beige lid, high and prickling carbonation all over the hotel sink. Ashy aroma with a sliver of Bamberg bacon about it. Appetising citrus-smoky balance; bitter dried black tea and thyme, choc orange and peel, crunch of botanicals, ashtray licks for dessert, lingering with smoke. VERY Tunnel-esque, believe it or not; citrus hoppage and ash, a bit rough and fizzing round the edges, approaching rauch levels of smoke mingled with gritty citrus. Rustic, refreshing and good.

A clear brown colored beer, with a thick beige head. The aroma of smoked malts with fruits, with some spices. The taste of smoked malts, dry some fruits like berries. The aftertaste is bitter, smoked with notes of fruits. This beer reminds me at a German Rauchbier.

1PT9FL OZ bottle. Pours a copper color with a small off white frothy head. Nose is smokey and salty. Palate is smooth with a light carbonation and a clean finish. Notes of smoked wood and some light salty notes, some light fruity notes appear toward the end. Finish is clean with a light smoke note left over.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2010 500 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy red amber colour with medium-size tan head. Aroma is smoke, resin, juniper, tar and remind also of fresh cutted wood (probably just an image). Dry but also sweetish flavour is also bitter, roasted malt, wood, smoke and tar. Quite delightful.

Bottle. Hazy copper, huge foamy head. Smoky aroma with notes of malt and juniper. The flavour is smoked malt, some bitterness and juniper. Medium-bodied and slightly bitter aftertaste. Very good brew.
dark brown color, foamy beige head. Excellent rich, full, warming. Delightfully I found lots of juniper and smoke. Some of my favourite things in a beer.

Bottled. Pours hazy coppery to brown with a huge an foaming head coloured in yellowish beige. Smoke dominates the nose but there´s also some fruity hops. In the aroma subtle smokiness and citric fruitness are well balanced. Some licorice and dark chocolate can also be found as well as burnt caramel. Towards the finish slightly herbal and more sweetish fruity hoppiness and juniper berries rise their heads. The flavor has dryish and smoky maltiness combined with sweetness of caramel and a hint of butterscotch. The finish is dry a bit chalky and it has medium bitterness and lingering smokiness. Medium bodied palate. Velvety texture whet the excess carbonation is gone. Sticky and bitterish finish with lingering smokiness and chalk. Tasty beer that might have some potential to age well.

0,5l bottle, batch 220. Hazy copper color with big white head. Nose is smoky, with touches of liquorice and citrus. Flavor is quity fruity, with a dominating juniper feel. Smoke and roasted malts are present as well. Quite strong alcohol toward the end. Rather nice brew.

Pours reddish brown with orange highlights and a beige head with large, fast-fading bubbles.  Aroma is outlandishly appetizing with prominent smoke, glazed ham, wood, caramel, slight gin notes when colder but those fade, caramel, nuts.  Tastes malty and smokey with wood, caramel, smoked meats (ham, jerky, sausage), wood, caramel, butterscotch, toffee, and slight spice (juniper?).  Finishes dry, woody, smokey like a faraway cookout, and earthy buttery hops.  Medium bodied, easy to drink, big bubbly carbonation.  This is at once subtle and totally exciting and captivating.  I love smoke beers and this certainly fits that category as well as traditional ale.  Ive fallen in love!

500 ml bottle. Hazy coppery-orange colour, thick and pillowy light beige head that leaves some lacing. Sweet, smoky malty aroma with a strong presence of fruits and spices. Smoked ham, fruits and juniper in the flavour. Warm and slightly ashy finish.

Bottle 0,5 l. Pours like a dunkel weizen, hazy light brown with a fizzy head. Nose has smoked malts, sour spiciness and citrus with a bit of maltiness and something I cant really put my finger on. Juniper might be there. Flavor is surprisingly fresh with a nice smoky twist on a sour body. Sourness is quite subtle, but the whole remains fresh and easily drinkable. Good, not as extreme as it might be.
Bottle 500ml. Myddy brown colour, foamy big bobbled beige head. Aroma has smoked ham, chocolate, spices. Taste is also smoky, some citrus and coffee. Nice smooth finish.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 A dark, copperbrown beer with a huge and beige head. Lot of coffee and roasted malts, smoke, sour and some liquirice, interesting aroma. Flavour is quite similar than aroma, coffee, smoke, roasted malts with chalk turns flavour into quite dry. In the aftertaste there are more malts and some spicy (maybe it is juniper). When the beer disappears from the glass, then the quite strange flavour starts to fascinate more and more. Nicely slippery to drink  with balance carbonation even it was not looks like that after beer was poured into the glass. A lighter version of brewerys Dark Force to coffee, smoke and rosted malts lovers, I like this beer.

Bottled (batch #220, brewed 20.04.09). 
Hazy deep red color, big cloudy beige head. Strong nose with smoke, wood and licorice.  First impression is hard mouthfeel and crisp carbonation. Taste is smokey (toasted bacon), with wet spruce and  notes of juniper. Suprisingly thin finish with some hops. A bit out of balance smoked beer.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2009 1. Bottle at the GBBF Bar Sans Frontiers Earls Court, London 08/08/2007
Strong smoked aroma. Mid brown coloured slightly hazy and strong in alcohol with a some dryness and bitterness in a crisp full smoked finish.
2. From the Bottle at Chris Os, GBBF Week 09/08/2008
Slightly smoked aroma. Mid brown coloured with some alcohol present. Crisp on the palate and smoked flavour with a little dryness in the finish.

This poured a brown color with a beige head. The aroma contains some herbal notes along with nutmeg, alcohol, raisins, and cherries. The flavor is rather sweet with a smokey presence. Do I taste BACON! Also some dark fruit and caramel showing. Overall this was an excellent beer.
scura bella schiuma buon apersitenza note legnodse leggero affumicato untoco di spezia in boccaattocco tostato un pèo di legno lieve affumicato un po di ginepro piuttosot secca

50 cl bottle at Haket on June 6, 2009. Thanks to Jonas (not on ratebeer)BB 20.02.11 - Batch 209Hazy red color, tan head. Sweet, malty, smoke scent. Malty, some smoke taste. Smoke aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
50 cl bottle batch 206. Pours dark brown with a high creamy brown head. Nice smoked aroma with some herb notes. good smoked flavor that stays very long.  Very interesting beer that is nice to drink.

Sampled at Springslickers Fish Fry 09.  Hazy orange pour with tan head and good lacing.  Nice mild smoke aroma becomes more prevalent in the flavor but still fairly unassuming.  Overpriced and a little weak.

Bottle. Smoky nose, sweet malt with caramel and chocolate background. Cloudy brownish orange with a fairly thick head and nice lacing. Smokiness is perfectly restrained, allowing malt and spice notes to come through. Pine and juniper combines with some fruit and chocolate. Very smooth palate, but with good spiciness.

Pours clear brown with a small tan head.  The aroma has light malt, bright spices, toffee, clean toasty caramel malt and a touch of cracker.  Medium crisp body that gets richer towards the end.  The flavor starts with clean toasted malt, then the smokiness comes through followed with almost a candi sugar aspect.  The finish seems to have a dry spice.  This is interesting, but I wouldnt want much.

Bottle. Moderate malt and hop smells of grain, toasted and resin, light earth for the yeast, with background notes of smoke, wood, and spice. Head is large, frothy, off-white with fair lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky brown, with large particles. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes moderately to heavily acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is medium,watery, with a fizzy carbonation and finishes lightly alcoholic. An okay Traditional Ale, but a little harsh in a few spots.

Bottle from City Beer in SF.  Pours a very dark brown with a lasting beige head.  Aroma of smoke and wood.  Flavor is roasty and smoky with dark fruits (juniper?), spices, and meaty notes.  Medium-full body with a creamy palate.

there are times i am so completely sick of myself that i have a hard time leaving the house for fear of inflicting myself on others. so i sit at home, and rot, generally downloading crap and listening to music that makes normal people want to jump off a cliff. so i did that for the last who knows how many hours, finally was able to turn on a light, put the razor blade away take a shower and clean this hole up. maybe soon ill e able to eat. dare to dream. so im in my place that is now not smelling of my sweat and pity, with the cool breeze blowing in the windowws, just got back from having a few beers in public, and now im ready, lets see what this beer is all about.looks really dark, but im in an unlit room, held to the window it has a bit of copper marron filtered through. nice fluffy head with big ol bubbles. a sweet smoke nose that makes me smile, smells like cedar and applewood. very inviting and makes my mouth water a bit while my jaws clench in anticipation. this is shockingly good. the smoke is there, with that smoke flavor that i taste from good cold smoked salmon, with a great wheaty banana and apple flavor, a great sweet malt body that holds perfesctly against the smoke. i must pick up some salty goat cheese and a bit of salmon to try with this. the bitter smoke finish is bringing so much at me i cant take it all in. meatyt, fruit juice(pear, apple)n light roast, sugared sugar puffs(you white trash brethren know what i mean) maple and with each taste something new, but always good. rich with a nice thick body. this is the opposite of a passage i read in a novel recently-" i was thankful for her giving me access to the solid, bland world she lived in"- emily jenkins from mr. posterior and the genius child. good book, good beer.
5 10 8 4 19

16.9 oz bottle.  Pours a clear dark amber body with a large fizzy beige head that had excellent staying power due to the vigorous carbonation.  The nose is a quite unique mix of light smoke, wood, light roast, and caramel malt.  The flavor is subtly smoky with nutty caramel maltiness, a bit on the sweeter side with an unusual herbal note that must be from the juniper berries but Id be hard pressed to identify it without knowing.  Nice lingering charred wood, coffee, and roast notes.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a bit too much fizzy active carbonation.  A really unique interesting brew, not quite a Smoked, but not quite anything in particular either.

SpringsLickers Fish Fry. Sample from a bottle thanks to Butters.  Fuzzy light brown, thin off white head.  Aroma is woody smoke, campfire and sausage.  Taste is burnt bacon, smoke, smoldering campfires.

Tasting day @ Alvinne. Bottle, 50 cl.
Amberbrown, with nice head. 
Aroma smoke, malts, bit hops. 
Full body.
Taste malts, smoked, bit nuts ?, little spice.
Good.

Pours dark red with a healthy, fizzy tan head, no lacing. Aroma of chocolate, smoke, juniper, cocoa, perhaps peat, spices, metallic hops. Chocolate and smoke dominate the flavours, with notes of spices and and ashy feel to it. Lively carbonated, full body. A nice sipper.

Huge, light-beige head over hazy, very dark red-brown beer. Juniper, holly, chocolate (malts), parsley, dark sugar, wood; complex and balanced nose. Dry, bitter, chocolate and wood, cigar ashes, and a flavour, reminiscent of the aroma of candles burning. Very balanced, discreet smoke. Spritzy MF, well-bodied, slick, seems heavy for its 6.5%. Extremely pleasing, relatively light beer, lightly smoked - great. Would make a superb X-mas ale...

07/04 0.5 l bottle brought by my friend Dija from Trondheim, thanks. It poured murky reddish brown body with medium sized ocher head. Very nice and cloying aroma, caramel, cocoa, woody, smoky like a ham and spiced with juniper a bit. Bitterish coffee flavor, caramel and cocoa. Some citrus fruits, probably from hops, smoky ashes and earthiness present as well. A bit lighter bodied that expected though, but pleasant and has so many subtle components. Long and very pleasant finish which was complex like the whole brew as well. Some acidity felt here as well. All in all, very good beer, best in a while, caps down to this one!

bacon, chocolate bacon, branches in the aroma .. . fantistico foameroes .. . not as smooth as most smoked brews .. . light sweetness, maybe even some juniper, some bacon fat and crisp bacon flavours .. . a good beer, but a tad rough ...

Bottle (batch 174) courtesy of and shared with heavy (huge, huge thanks!), whose friend brought it from Trondheim I think.  Poured a murky, very dark ruby red, with a medium sized slightly off white head.  Smokey nose, buttery, some light spice and... coffee? Hmm. Nice though.  The taste is dominated by the smoked malt, some agrumey notes (quality hops?), slightly acidic (very weak), light yoghurty notes, nice spicy notes (juniper?), a bit soapy though. Very interesting and nice! By far the best beer weve had today.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a generous tan head.Smoked malt comes first to the nose, followed by a touch of juniper.
Light smoky complex flavour, nuts and caramell, ends bitter and slightly sour.

Nice aroma of malts, smoke, berries.  The appearance is an attractive deep chestnut brown, nice tan head.  The flavor has the nicest qulaities of smoked beers, the flavors of smoke, malts, nuts, junper berries. The finish is like inhaling the smoke of a campfire.  This is a nicely crafted beer in its own right.  However, I am really given over to traditional ales.  I love the idea of trying recreations of beers from ancient times.  This was very enjoyable.

Pours dark ruby with a smallish tan head. Aroma is smoked malt, juniper, some slight dark fruit. Flavor is earthy, Smokey, woody, caramel malt, raisin and juniper. Smoke really comes through in the finish. Great beer.

500ml bottle from west lakeview.....pours a dark semi-opaque amber brown with a thick and fluffy light beige head....aroma of juniper, wood, smoke and a fair amount of nuttiness..... flavors of caramel malt, nuts, and a sour bitterness in the finish.  sweet overall profile.  crisp lively carbonation.  generally pretty decent.  i would have this again if given the chance but wouldnt go seeking it out.

Bottle. Pours a medium red, very large and lasting tan head. Aroma is sweet and maybe a touch of smoke. Flavor is more of the same, Juniper is more pronounced, but not like in Gin, its mellow not as cloying. Some touches of wood. Finish is very unique, dry, smokey and somewhat refreshing.

500 ml bottle thanks to dchmela. Pours a ruby red color with a murky body and a medium light brown head that dissipates into a fizzy bubbly mix. The aroma is mostly smoke, some caramel malt maybe. The flavor is interesting; smoky and earthy, some berries and fruit, a bit of sweet strawberry as it warms. Lots of interesting nooks and crannies here, unusual and nice. The idea of a farm beer really appeals to me.

It looks and smells great, but it leaves a taste like roasted walnuts and smoked fish. I would try it again, but the first bottle almost tasted skunky.

Ive had other beers from this brewer, so I dont fault the quality. It just didnt sit well with me.

This reddish brown beer poured into a dimpled mug with a bubbly tan head than soon fizzled away. There is a strange sweet aroma, perhaps from the juniper. The flavor is roasted malt with a strange fruity element, which is likely also from the juniper, and a smoky finish. This is a unique brew that is both tasty and refreshing.

Bottled. A deep red beer with a huge brown head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of smoke - is that beechwood? but also some notes of caramel and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of smoked malt, caramel, juniper, roasted malt, and some wood, leading to a dry woody and somewhat smokey finish, where the smoke lingers for a long time.

Bottled sample. Hazy brown in colour with medium carbonation. Fairly heavy beechwood and alder smoke aromas, along with a hint of orchard fruit. The smoke is a bit more restrained in the mouth, and is balanced by sone notes of mild juniper and roasted malts. Medium bodied and dry finishing. Quite nice overall.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy brown with a 2 finger foamy tan head that leaves decent lacing.  The nose is smoky malts, cured meat and juniper.  The taste is bbq ribs, burnt malt and light ashy chocolate with a bitter juniper/piney finish.  Medium, prickly body.  Interesting beer  I like it.

Deep ruby brown, large foaming head. Nose is remarkably smoky, some burnt wood but mainly smoked meat. Malts are semi-dry with touches of cocoa powder and molasses. High effervescence. Finish is fizzy, smoky and short. Very enjoyable.

Bottle into stein.

Pours chocolate brown, kind of murky, with a huge, fluffy tan head. Some visible effervescence around the edges of the glass.

Nose is quite smoky, with an organic peatiness around it, raisin and dark fruit underneath.

Taste has lots of dark fruit (raisins) and cocoa up front, some brown sugar as well, with the peaty smoke coming in about midway and really coming out around the finish. Finish is juicy, smoky, just a hint of smoked sausage, echoes of raisins and brown sugar wrapped in smoke. Really nice. Smoke contributed to the beer without totally wrapping up the entire character like some rauchbiers.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, light carbonation.

Drinkability is really rather high for a smoked beer - I could have drank more than one of these, and the sweetness in this coupled with the smoke would make this an absolute grand slam with pulled pork barbecue.

Foggy amber pour, with a large whitish foam head. Earthy aromas of raisin, sweet malt, slight red berries and peat/smoke. Poured into the dimple mug and the lacing lasted strong throughout the entire beer, but was not as sticky of a mouthfeel as this might indicate. Flavor has some malt, light red fruit, prune and, brown sugar, smoke. Maybe juniper berry, but I really have no idea what juniper berry tastes like. Solid medium body but finishes very clean with not much lingering good or bad. There is a creaminess to it that works really well with the flavors. I thought this was a little dopplebock-esque, with all the good comparisons that might come with it.
Unique, drinkable and worth trying. For sure one of the best of this style, whatever that may be, Ive had.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: 1PT .9FL OZ, capped bottle (Batch NR 109-brewed Nov 07, best before Nov 09, sampled Jan 09): thick & smokey aromatics with undertones of dark fruit, hickory and pine needles.  Gorgeous burnt ruby coloured body with a large off tan, bubbly head.  Overly carbonated at first, but settled into a smooth, almost silky texture.  Dark, caramelized ham flavour, leaving a sticky, brown sugar and herbal taste on the lips.  A great accompaniment to a snowy winter day...complex enough to change and develop over the course of the afternoon, yet simple enough to be straightforward delicious the whole time.  I really love the interplay here: smokey, hoppy, earthy, fruity.  Great.
Brown in color and cloudy with a large beige head. Aroma is very smokey (tobacco and firewood) with some notes of caramel and malt. Taste is of black pepper, smoked jalepenos and chocolate.

16oz bottle. Pours a mahogany color with a mid sized khaki head. Lots of carbonation, perhaps too much. The nose is cooked bacon, raspberries, and molasses. The flavor is pretty similar but the carbonation kills some of the complexity. Very smokey, almost tobacco like but its just shy of being harsh, pretty much perfectly done in that regard. Some berry notes but not enough and there is some caramel and molasses in the flavor but it is completely dominated by the smoke flavor. This one needs a little more work but I think with a little more experimentation this well be one of the best smoked beers in the world.

Rating #600.  500mL bottle.  Batch #109.  Brewed:  Nov. 2007.  Best before:  Nov.  2009.  Pours a rich amber/mahogany color with a HUGE khaki head.  Lots of sour berries in the roasty, toasted grain aroma.  Thin to medium-bodied.  Sweet caramel and tangy juniper berries upfront.  Finishes with some light biscuitiness and smoke.  I think this ones prime has passed.

Bottle on 11/30/2008 at the 3rd Annual Richmond Industry Gathering. Cloudy dark amber body with a medium creamy tan head. Sweet smoke, dark fruit and caramel aroma. Very nice smoke flavor with some caramel and molassas. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Thanks for my bro for picking this up!  Pours a rich brownish color with pillowy off white head.  Aroma is light juniper berry and smoked malt..  Aroma is almost anti-septic and band-aid like, but its not a horrible smell.  Just an unusual smell.  Taste is light smoked peat and malt with some toasted grain and juniper.  Mild carbonation and light bitter finnish this is a great brew!

Pours a dark amber color with a large creamy off-white head that fades slowly and leaves a few streams of bubbly lacing.  Aroma is smoke, peat, slight citrus, and juniper - in the vein of styles of Gin.  Taste is old ale meets smoked ale - burned roasts, chocolate, liquid smoke, and a bit of bitterness.

(bottle - 500 ml) Murky brown color with a fluffy tan head. Aroma is very smoky and peaty with some roasted and smoke mixed with a little bit of meat, citrus, and spice. Flavor is very smoky and roasty with some good bitter and burnt malt notes, some very intense spice, and a roasted malt and bitter finish. Aftertaste is spicy with some citrus and a nice warming alcohol taste. Very tasty.

Pours a cloudy murky brown with a creamy light tan head. The nose is smokey, meaty, lightly sweet, fruity, citrus and spice. The flavor is spicy, very lively, smoke is more of a background note, waxy bitterness. Either the hops or the juniper is adding an astringency. The mouthfeel makes it seem Belgian, very lively.

Bottle 500 ml batch 72, Appearance:  murky ,dark brown appearance with large ,big pillowy ,rocky brown shaded head. Aroma: super blend of fresh mineral hop feel with very good clean smoke side. Light spice at end. Very good. Flavor/Palate: mid bodied. Blend of smoked malts with gold ones. Little fruity hints, sweeter edge followed with hop episode and dry alcohol. Multi layered ale. Very neat creation.

16.9 oz bottle.  Clear cherry brown with a balsa head.  Nose is briefly dark berries then smoke and juniper.  Medium body with a tang.  Taste is bittersweet chocolate, red and black licorice, and ash finishing with sour and bitter juniper.  Lingering smoke.

Nose is smokey and woody, dark cloudy brown, pours a medium sized toffee head. Taste is a smokey malt, pitfruit, and hints of a campfire. Medium bodied, very nicely balanced, bitter with a dry finish. Great!
Slight floral aroma, with a smokey bitter taste and getting a sweet ending and aftertaste. Nice desingn of the Bottle Etiquette.

Now thats a smoked beer!! kinda dark red, small quickly dissapearing head. nose is smokey, some wood some coffee little juniper berries, flavor similar little malt sweetness, good smoke but not overpowering, dry finish, would be amazing with BBQ

Pours with a five+ finger, thick light tan head that fades slowly and leaving traces of lace. Cloudy deep amber color, yeast left in bottom of bottle. Good carbonation, medium bodied. Smoky, caramel nose. Flavor is sweet, woody and smoky with some caramel. Pricey at $11.50 for a 500ml bottle from Tully’s Beer and Wine Wells, Me.

Bottle, 8/07. Aroma of generalized fruitiness/berriness, occasional wafts of smoke (spreading as it warms), and some marshmallow. Flavor tons of smoked wood. A veritable campfire with lots of spiciness flying about. Malt still evident alongside the smoke and spices though, and increasingly distinct berry notes follow as well. Finish very nice and smoky. Good stuff.

Bottle, batch 86, brewed 8/07.  Pours a dark murky brown with a light tan head.  Aroma of spices and spruce.  Flavor of spices initially, some sweet fruitiness, and smoke in the finish.  An interesting and tasty beer!

From 2007 bottle. Musty woody aroma, with some juniper and smoke notes and light grass hops. Mild molasses or caramel sweetness in there, too. A very rough, raw aroma, but it grows on you. Dark dark brown, clear, wtopped with foamy light tan lacing lasting head. Medium heavy watery body with quite effervescent carbonation. Starts with decent sweetness that seems like light molasses or burnt caramel. Woody notes and smoky flavor comes in pretty quick, with light juniper taste though it’s not huge. Finishes with pretty good bitterness from hops and smoky grains or juniper. Dry with light caramel sweetness and a touch of alcohol. Pretty nice ale, though not as tasty as a gotlandsdricke.

Bottle. Pours a muddy brown color with a fluffy off white head. Aroma of smoke, wood, and light roasted malt. Tastes of smoke, wood, and light hops and roasted malt. Has a thin dry smoky finish. A different and unique beer.

Sampled 11/1/08. Batch 100.  This traditional ale pours a deep amber color from a 50cl bottle. Medium sized white foamy head with excellent retention and nice lacing. The aroma is slightly smoked malts, wood and juniper berries. A medium bodied ale. The malts are smoky and roasty with some malt sweetness. The hops are earthy and piney. Interesting mix of smoked malts and juniper berries. Nice balance. Lively carbonation. Tannins from the wood come out as it warms. The interesting mix of flavors makes this a very interesting beer.  Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter and woody.

Bottle shared with BrianK. The artwork alone sold me on this one.  Bottle pours a mahogany body with 1 finger dark head.  A bit smoky and woody but oddly spiced with juniper, caramel malt, and light spices.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2009 50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Oslo, shared with Bananamaniac.

A very special and cool beer!

Pours a dark red/brown color with a small, but nice, foamy head.

Aroma of smoke, burnt wood (almost like an old campfire), berries & juniper needles. Very nice smelling-beer imo.

Flavour is of smoked malt, burnt wood, some berries and juniper needles, notes of some malty sweetness. A very special taste overall.

Mouthfeel is good, though its a bit thin, but I like it anyway.

Overall a very unique beer!

500 mL bottle from Sam’s Quik Shop. Batch 72, brewed 4/07, best buy 4/10. Pours a hazy berry red with a 2-finger head, good retention and low lacing. Aroma is pretty much straight smoke, with some spice and caramel. Very smoky taste, again with caramel and spice. Very smoky. Sausage smoky. Nice balance.

Smoke hits you upfront in an unusual way. Really good, well balanced beer. The aroma is burnt wood, smoke, chocolate. Flavor is much of the same, again, great balance. Some notes of caramel malted sweetness.

Batch #70 ~ 2007 Vintage
10/07/2008:  Haandbryggeriet Norwegian Wood is briming with good, woody smokiness with a hint of smoked meat in the aroma paired with some subtle milky, chocolate, and yeasty notes.  This beer is heavy carbonated at this point as evidenced by the loud sound the cap made when I popped it off, the continuous rush of bubbles from the bottom of the glass to the top, and the very large, foamy beige head that loiters on the top.  The color of this beer is a hazy, deep red with honey-colored highlights.  The flavor is actually somewhat unexpected.  It is mostly chocolate with some roasty and char.  I dont really get any of the meaty smoke or even regular smoke that I was expecting.  It is pretty much char and semi-sweet and dark chocolates.  It becomes more dry with a slightly overbearing yeast flavor as it warms (I prefer the flavor when it is a bit more cold).  There is also a slight sour/tartness that must be from the juniper berries.  The finish is dry, roasty, and has a mild bitterness to it.  There is thick, puffy lacing on the glass and even though the carbonation appears to be higher, the medium-full body of this beer prevents it from coming across as overcarbonated or fizzy.  Overall, this beer is very good.  At first I wished that it had more of the meaty smokiness to it.  However, this isnt supposed to be a smoked beer.  Therefore, I believe that the deep, roasted malt and char characteristics are more in line with the intentions of this brew.  The smoke is more subtle resulting in a very balanced beer and a delightful drinking experience.
1 pt. 6 fl oz bottle (6.5% Alc/Vol, Brewed: Mar. 07, Best Bef: Mar 10, $7.49+tax) from Rivers Bend Wine and Spirits in Maineville, Ohio.  Rating #288 for this beer...

2008 Bottle - Pours a murky reddish with a large off-white head that lingers...aroma is burnt wood, bitters, flavour is somewhere between campfire and old sponge...nice smoke and interesting palate, but there is something that almost gives off a mushroomy fungal note, fun beer but better to share...

pours a hazy reddish brown with a large lasting tan head.
Aroma is light camp fire smoke and some tart fruitiness, light roasted malt as well.
Flavour is sweet malt, some chocolate tones and some semi-tart fruitiness. A pronounced lingering smokey finish.
I thought that this was pleasantly balanced between the smokiness and the other flavours. Most times I find rauchbiers to be way too smokey for my taste. So the fact that this one is a ’traditional ale’ and has toned it down a bit while still allowing the smoke to play a major part is good by me.

a thick woody aroma. lots of burnt woods, and roasted burnt malt. loads of burnt wood flavour, and more burnt malt, this is super malty, and is dominated by wood. interesting, but quite one dimensional.

Poured a clear mohogany with a fizzy tall off-white head.  Aroma of sweet fruit, lots of charred wood, some roastiness.  Taste is very smoky with lots of charred wood (almost bacon-like), with some notes of sweet fruit and some dry alcohol peeking through on occasion.  Lots of carbonation gives a surprisingly lively feel to the body.  I’m not an immediate fan of smoked beer, which was my primary reservation with this one.  Well made I suppose, which is why I still gave it a decent score even though it’s my preference of flavor profile.

Bottle from Knightly Spirits. I love smoked ales and haven’t been able to find many of them, so I opened this one with earnest. Pours a small tan head with a black body that displays brown hues when held up to the light. Tight curtains of lace. Aromas are surprisingly sour with yeast. Flavors include campfire wood, malts, ripe red fruit, and chocolate. A solid sour yeast and bitter hops presence tastes amazingly in-balance with the smokiness going on here. Highly carbonated and full bodied. Not as smokey as anticipated, but this is a very pleasant and interesting brew.

Bottled 50cl. Batch 161. It pours a dark amber beer with a beautiful creamy beige head. Good head retention. The nose is excellent - Wonderfully smoky, dry and woody accompanied by hops, tea, tarragon, ginger and licorice. Some lactic components and berries sneaking in. Terribly complex and pleasant. Outstanding taste. Perfectly balanced. Dry and smoky. Lactic, lightly acidic, woody. Decent bitterness. Beautiful lacework. Some juniper berries and quite a lot of ginger and grapefruit showing up. Excellent hop profile. A nice bite appearing with the swallow. More hops show up in the finish which is very dry. The smoky component, hops and juniper still being present after quite a while. A unique experience. Thanks a lot larsga for this amazing beer.

Bottle. Pours with a dark copper color and a fairly sizeable head. Aromas are of bacon and smoke. Flavors are of smoke, soked meat and some lingering spiciness, perhasp due to the berries?
Very smooth and complex, but less smoky than a Schlenkerla which is a good thing in my mind.
Bottle Pours out a amber topped with a tan head. Aroma of smoke and sweetness. Tast more of the smoke and plenty of wood. A nice brew.

Deep amber color with an uncontrollable beige head that threatened to overspill every time I poured more beer into the glass.  Nose of caramel corn and used firewood.  Very meaty beer, with smoked bacon and pit ham.  Lots of malty sweetness, with oak, burnt coffee, and juniper in the finish.  If you like smoked beers, you will like this.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 This beer smells just like my shirt after I have been standing over my grill for an hour or two. This beer also tastes like meat after it has been on my grill for an hour or two. Hints of berry floating around, with notes of spice and wood. Maybe the slightest hint of vanilla and other fruit.  Mmmm...smoke and meat....droooooooool.

In the 0.5mL bottle from Beertopia. Oh, this is good stuff. It’s a 60 degree fall afternoon in Nebraska and this beer really fits the bill. Pours a hazy brown with a yellow-ochre colored head. Lines of thin carbonation bubbles more in regiment up the glass. The aroma smells like Old Sledge’s smokehouse while he was curing ham. The flavor is not like a bamburger ham sandwich, but it is no shrinking violet either. This is solidly smoky. The only negative is that the body is just slightly o th thin side for this much flavor. The finish has a slightly tart taste, but I’m not sure that I can discern any juniper berries here. The only flavor other than th roasted smoke is a nice bitter chocolate.

Pours an attractive burnt caramel with a touch of scarlet when held to the light. The nose is smooth and smokey, as is the flavor. I’m surprised to see that this isn’t a smoked. A nice beer, but not worth the price.

pours hazy brown with a small tan head that leaves quite fast. nose is smoke, liquorice, meaty, and cherry. taste is smoky but not cloyingly smoky. and nice cherry flavours. sticky mouthfeel. thoroughly enjoyable.

Poured a hazy brown color with forathy tan head.  Aroma is brown sugared beef jerky.  Flavor sweet caramel chocolate beginning that transforms into a smokey jerked meat flavor with a bitter finish.  Overall, very good.

Poured from a 500ml bottle (Batch 86, Brewed: Aug. 07) and served in an English pint glass.  This beer poured a hazy copper brown with a lasting head of tight, tan foam.  Some nice lacing was left behind.  The aroma of the beer was made up of burnt wood, smoke, toasted caramel, spicy and fragrent juniper, and also some earthy yeast.  The flavor included smoked meats, campfire, dark fruits, burnt caramel, and a solid dose of lasting juniper at the finish.  Definately interesting.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with mild carbonation.  Despite the strong smoke presence, the juniper really shines through.  Tasty and unique, but not something I would drink all the time.

bottle from knightly spirits...and from Eric Sanchez, thanks RICO!  Brown pour with a tan head.  smell is balanced between malt and smoke. Flavor is smokey and malty.  Hops at end.  Reminds me of a jerky beer.  Interesting and pretty good for a smoked beer!

Perhaps the first (as far as I know) commercial beer in Norway after the reinheitsgebot disappeared that has utilized the old Norwegian tradition of spicing beer with juniper as was common before hops found their way to Norway.

Slightly hazy, colour ranges from amberish brown to niqoutine yellow. 
Nice foamy cream white head (reminds me of something in between a stout and a Belgian dubbel, which tells me there might be some candi in there..). 

Sweet malty caramelish, piny, resinous aroma with a touch of smoke and a fruity hoppy hint. 

Nice acidic, slightly vinous attack on the palate. Discreet bitterness  Pretty dry & medium bodied. Slightly short aftertaste.

The taste is vinous (red, think zinfandel/shiraz) on the attack as well with a bit of caramelly malt, but the smoke (although not too strong) takes too much attencion. A pity, since i know that there are some juniper berries there as well as a nice malt profile that gets lost in the smoke.

Overall a nice beer though, but i hope theyll amplify the juniper and cut down on the smoke on next batch. 

Batch 148, by the way.
Bottle, batch 142. I heard of this beer during a visit to the brwery a couple of years ago, it was a pleasure to taste it today.

Bottle Batch 100. Aroma was smokey and sweet spices on the nose. Brown body with big head that eventually settles down to normal. Smokey wood in the flavor along with some sweet malts. Texure was thick and a filling beer put me to sleep.
Hazy brown with large beige head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt and caramel. Flavor likewise with a sweet esmoky end.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Chandler, marked "Batch 100."  Poured a murky amber with a frothy head of straw-colored head.  Smells like a struck match with notes of alcohol in the nose.  Plenty of smoke in the flavor, much like a rauch beer, with faint caramel and juniper.  Thick, malty body with mld carbonation.  Hot alcohol finish.  Noticeable sediment.

0,5l. Poors a large offwhite head which stays for a long while. Dark brownish appearance, slighty foggy looking. Aroma of smoked malt, fruits and coffee. Tastes of fruit, burnt smoked malt, coffee, long slighlty bitter and alcohol filled finish. Almost no carbonation. Overrall a nice beer. The only downer I can point my finger on is the slightly misplaced use of flames on the label.

IBF 07 A tasty dark ale with just a hint of bark. If trees made beer, this is what it would taste like. And then I would drink all of the tree. Bless any brewery that experiments in alternative methods or ingredients.

500 ml, Batch 72 brewed April 2007. Clear dark brown-copper with a lasting three-finger head. Aroma is spicy-sweet hickory smoke and light banana. Flavor is mesquite smoke, caramel, earthy-peppery spices, dried cedar, char, dark roasted walnut, and light alcohol. Great aftertaste of peppery-sweet smoked bacon. Medium body  is dryish and has a slight chest-warming effect. Only complaint is it is too bubbly-frothy in the mouth for my tastes, but this is still a very good brew.

[Batch #72] Pours a deep clear, but very dark, ruby brown with a large foamy tan froth on top.  Great aroma, smokey bacon and pineapple, sweet teriyaki, hickory with notes of candied cranberries.  This is Thanksgiving in a bottle... smoked turkey jerky with juniper-berries on top.   Really a great flavor.  The light smoke and tangy berries meld so well together, with the berries being the stronger of the two, especially in the finish.   Light glassy body with lots of large, but soft, carbonation bubbles.   Lots of campfire and berries in the finish.

Batch 72, bottled April 07, imbibed July 08. Pours red/brown with a huge beige head. Aroma is lightly smoked and a bit spicy, with woody and nutty notes. Medium body. Flavor is burnt wood, smoke, earth, and grassy hops. The finish is dry and just a bit bitter. Very well put together, never over the top, just a very drinkable and tasty beer.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2009 19.07.2008. 0.5 l. Batch148, brewed march 08, BB march 10. Almost without head. smokey smell. Spiced with Juniperus. Sharpe hoppy taste, aftertaste is short and bitter. 29.05.2009, 0,5l Bottle, Batch 209, brewed february 09, BB february 11. More carbonation then the last test, with yellow-brown head. Lovely roasted malty aroma. Very nice.

500ml bottle from monopoly outlet, Oslo. Pours hazy brown with small offwhite head. Faint aromas of woodfire and us hops. Wonderful smoky taste, not too much like those german ones, and a bit fruity. Fantastic...

500ml bottle at The Rake, with renffisch, duff and harrisoni, 17th May 2008. Bottle was from batch 66, brewed Feb 2007. Dark reddish amber with a solid whitish head. Very unique and wonderful aroma - pine, juniper, wood smoke, herbs. Utterly lovely smoky malt flavours, balanced by a dry, lingering hoppiness. Not too heavy either. A very different, very, very enjoyable beer.

Thanks for sharing Sick_boy.  Pours with a slightly cloudy, deep amber body topped by a thick, quickly disappearing head with lots of lacing.  It’s smoky and malty with a slight sweetness and a little hop character.  Medium bodied and very tingly from the carbonation.

50cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Batch 142. It poured a dark brown colour with a light brown head that disappears fast in the glass. The aroma smells of malts, smoke, dark chocolate and I also think there is a hint of juniper. The flavour is a bit bitter and tastes of smoked malts, dark chocolate.
The aftertaste is suprisingly short.

Brewed 4/7, Tasted 7/8 Batch72.
Huge tan head on a brown body. The head demands patience. Smoke, and dark fruit. Creamy when drunk with head. Bitter chocolate. Juniper adds a nice hop character to keep smoke from overplay. Nice and well rounded for so many strong characters.

Bottle from Uto beer, Borough Market, Lahndan Tahn 21-06-08   Mid brown unclear pour with off white possibly tan head. Quite a bit of carbonation to this beer and for a while Im reminded of a guiness pour as the head settles. Smokey wafts come forth and the taste is lightly smokey with a nice bitterness and then some sweetness joining in. Its a fine beer but not quite as good as I expected.

0,5 l bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger - shared with Roger. Batch # 109. Dark brown color, nice beige head. Aroma is smoked malt and dark fruit. Flovor is smoked, sweet malt, chocolate, dark fruit. Balanced and lovely beer. Not my last bottle Norwegian Wood!

16.9 oz bottle.  Batch 100, brewed 10/07, best by 10/09.  Pours a murky light brown with a huge big bubbled rocky fizzy light tan head that retains well and leaves a little lacing.

The aroma is complex - toasted chocolate malts, dark fruits, smoke, wood and a little alcohol.

The flavor is bready chocolate malts, dark fruits, fruitcake and spices with a decent bitter finish.  The mouthfeel is medium with lots of sharp carbonation.

Overall, an interesting and fun beer.  It tastes interesting, but doesnt quite align with my tastes.

Bottle pours a cloudy copper body with a fluffy beige head. Spiderweb lacing is left on the glass. Aroma is caramel, subtle wood smoke, and funky juniper berries. The smoked malt is more evident in the taste than the aroma. The juniper berries add a strange earthy/herbal presence, somewhat like a good gin. Bitterness is assertive and seems to be from the hops profile. Caramel maltiness balances well and some dark roasty notes emerge near the finish. Complex and enjoyable.

After reading the thread touting this beer, I put the bottle I had in my beer cellar into the fridge to enjoy this weekend.  I decided to open it last night to celebrate my sons graduation from high school earlier in the day.  This was no minor achievement for him as he has autism and this was a challenging road for him.  Congratulations Nicholas, I am proud of you!

Ok, on to the beer...16.9 oz. bottle pours a cloudy dark brown that allows a bit of light to pass through with a moderately large off-white head that lasted until the end of the glass and left a coating of foam with each sip.  Very pleasant aroma of smoke along with some herbal notes, which I am assuming are the juniper berries.  The flavor was equally nice with the smokiness not at all overdone along with some malt.  A bit of herbal/spice near the end, which I again assume are the juniper berries.  Initially, this beer is very effervescent and tingles the tongue almost like a glass of seltzer.  I let the beer rest for 15 minutes and came back to it, and the beer had settled nicely and the heavy effervescence had dissipated.  Moderate bitterness at the finish.  Very enjoyable.

In short: Original dry woody spicy tasty beer.  Very interesting.
How: Bottle, 500ml, almost 1 year old
The look: Cloudy redish amber body with a large beige head with medium retention
In long: Nose is light-moderate smoke.  Body is very fluffy.  Unusual flavour mixing dry tree bark, sawdust and spices.  Quite spicy with some cloves, cinnamon and other spicy notes that I usually find in Christmas beer.  Id even add some streak/bbq-like spices to this spicy array.  Limited fruity notes (probably because the spiciness overwhelms them.  A whole lot of dry leafy spicy hops.  Back of the bottle has a story that reads: Once, every farm in Norway was required by law to brew its own Ale. .  How times have changed, I never thought I could feel like that again, I now want my girlfriend to put me to bed and read me fairy tales like that.

(Norway) Courtesy of AFI96, thx Waylo.  A nice deep amber color with a med-tan head.  The aroma is of beech wood, and Kunzler smokehouse meats. Nice lasting head, Taste is smoky and dry with a foamy mouthfeel. This one was very different for me, I dont think ive had any quite like this before.  Very unique !!!

Shared this one with BeerGestapo. Pours very dark brown with a fluffy tan head that sticks around throughout the entire glass. Smells of campfire and sweetenend malts. Lots of smoke in the flavor backed up by some nice roasted bitterness. Very drinkable and quite enjoyable, Im glad I picked this one up.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2009 Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Orange-amber colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. vinius, rasin-notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate and very lively, difficult to pour in glas.

Poured from a 16.9 oz bottle.
Color was brown , a bit murky. Quite a bit of white head.
Aroma was smoky , more of a fireplace smoke and not a beechwood or alderwood smoke.
Taste was smoky but not overpowering. A slight hop contribution but not much. I couldnt detect the juniper berries.
Mouthfeel was fair. Not as silky as I had hoped.
Drinkability: it was a unique smoke beer and Im glad I tried it but I wouldnt seek it out again.

Savannah, Ga. - Habersham Beverage Warehouse - 500 ml bottle.Dark copper colored pour with a long lasting spritzy khaki colored head. Aroma of smoked meat and sardines.
